commit_message:
Reset no_proxy when the node is installed behind a proxy

Date: Mon Mar 16 09:15:00 2015 -0500

Problem:
=======
When devstack is installed behind a proxy with proxy variables
http_proxy and https_proxy being exported and without exporting
no_proxy, the installation will fail. The reason is that any REST
request sent to Keystone will be redirected to the proxy server.

Solution:
========
Fix involves appending no_proxy variable with localhost,HOST_IP,
SERVICE_HOST,RABBIT_HOST,CINDER_SERVICE_HOST, GLANCE_SERVICE_HOST,
HEAT_API_CFN_HOST, KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST, KEYSTONE_AUTH_HOST,
if they are not included already and then exporting the variable.

Closes-Bug: 1291111

Change-Id: I3cdace056b74fec111d24d222a886716a063d340
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/88/94988/26 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Reset no_porxy variables export_no_proxy_variables

subject: keystone faster password checks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-17 12:54:55.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/d006116ee18f0a784649d68a9bcd87ea4ac03987', 'message': 'keystone faster password checks

keystone indirectly uses the crypt(3) function for password
checking. Most Linux distribution uses the same
function for handling the password hashes
for example the ones in the /etc/shadow.

The crypt has a rounds parameter which related to how many times the functions,
calculates sha-512 hash.

The glibc default is 5000 rounds, but keystone uses 40000 rounds.
A password check with 40000 rounds is around ~30ms CPU time,
with 5001 ~4ms.

keystone needs to call crypt(3) for every token create,
its cpu usage is very visible.

Change-Id: Ia7c359df0d2f846a16b9fb98937f2995e9791010
'}]
commit_message:
keystone faster password checks

keystone indirectly uses the crypt(3) function for password
checking. Most Linux distribution uses the same
function for handling the password hashes
for example the ones in the /etc/shadow.

The crypt has a rounds parameter which related to how many times the functions,
calculates sha-512 hash.

The glibc default is 5000 rounds, but keystone uses 40000 rounds.
A password check with 40000 rounds is around ~30ms CPU time,
with 5001 ~4ms.

keystone needs to call crypt(3) for every token create,
its cpu usage is very visible.

Change-Id: Ia7c359df0d2f846a16b9fb98937f2995e9791010
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/54/165054/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use less sha-512 rounds for passwords checks iniset $KEYSTONE_CONF DEFAULT crypt_strength 5001

subject: Add RAW image support for Ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-06 10:10:12.000000000', 'files': ['functions', 'stackrc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/56ace317f8ba2985a67f50e92976cb67439c69f6', 'message': 'Add RAW image support for Ceph

To work in ideal circonstances, Ceph needs a RAW image in Glance. This
allows either Nova or Cinder to take advantage of the copy-on-write
cloning functionnality. This commit introduces a generic change_img_format
function that can be used by any component.
The default behavior will now download the cirros image and will convert
it into RAW.

Change-Id: I0d1157829f7131925d2d6918e8bb0f7cebe1e726
Signed-off-by: Sbastien Han <sebastien.han@enovance.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add RAW image support for Ceph

To work in ideal circonstances, Ceph needs a RAW image in Glance. This
allows either Nova or Cinder to take advantage of the copy-on-write
cloning functionnality. This commit introduces a generic change_img_format
function that can be used by any component.
The default behavior will now download the cirros image and will convert
it into RAW.

Change-Id: I0d1157829f7131925d2d6918e8bb0f7cebe1e726
Signed-off-by: Sbastien Han <sebastien.han@enovance.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/50/126250/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ceph needs a flat image # Later this image will be converted in RAW if [[ "$ENABLED_SERVICES" =~ 'ceph' ]]; then case "$VIRT_DRIVER" in libvirt) IMAGE_URLS="http://download.cirros-cloud.net/${CIRROS_VERSION}/cirros-${CIRROS_VERSION}-x86_64-disk.img" ;; *) ;; esac fi

commit_message:
Set Tempest config public_network_dualstack

A new tempest config option, public_network_dualstack, was created
to address an issue with an existing test when run in a dualstack
environment.

This change sets the option to true if IP_VERSION=4+6, and false
otherwise.

Depends-On: I0f9ea98cb84aa72cb1505fb9ff8ac61561cc1376
Change-Id: I48753afb11f12d5a77dc22d69b97149a28798d91
Partially-implements: blueprint multiple-ipv6-prefixes
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/35/168235/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "$IP_VERSION" = "4+6" ]; then public_network_dualstack=true else public_network_dualstack=false fi iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG network public_network_dualstack "$public_network_dualstack"

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-07 20:28:11.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/bbf2a1888de151115a3bf83478b25d041a58d03f', 'message': 'Wait for screen to respond

Rather than waiting a full three seconds always, have new screen

Alternative to I0e6476176fc8589efc4e40e78c2231f704d14e45

Change-Id: I2646874f5d7b4761ed523e53ef0b1f1469d4d1fa

commit_message:
Wait for screen to respond

Rather than waiting a full three seconds always, have new screen
processes output to a temp file and monitor for the write.  This
should assure us the new screen is up and ready to receive commands.

Alternative to I0e6476176fc8589efc4e40e78c2231f704d14e45

Change-Id: I2646874f5d7b4761ed523e53ef0b1f1469d4d1fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/57/171357/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # stuff command into bash to make sure it is alive; slow clouds # can take a while. local tmp=$(mktemp) local count=0 while [ 1 ]; do if [ $count -gt 5 ]; then die $LINENO "screen $name did not respond within timeout" fi screen -S ${SCREEN_NAME} -p $name -X stuff $"date > $tmp\n" if [ -s $tmp ]; then break else # first time we're likely to miss the size update, so # don't sleep for long because it's probably ready if [ $count -eq 0 ]; then sleep 0.1 else sleep 3 fi fi count=$((count+1)) done rm -f $tmp
deleted_lines: # sleep to allow bash to be ready to be send the command - we are # creating a new window in screen and then sends characters, so if # bash isn't running by the time we send the command, nothing happens sleep 3

commit_message:
Glance Artifact support in devstack

Artifacts service extends Glance's functionality
to store not only the VM images but any other binary
objects accompanied with composite metadata.

To enable with devstack simply add the following
line to your local.conf

    enable_service g-artifacts

When deployed artifacts will be listening on port 9393.

Change-Id: If77a56e05a46fb5a8752fb566dca74df3e086320
Depends-on: Ia20716f3c75299f796879299da317b2e81496088
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/89/169289/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF=$GLANCE_CONF_DIR/glance-artifacts.conf GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_PASTE_INI=$GLANCE_CONF_DIR/glance-artifacts-paste.ini # Configure Glance artifacts cp $GLANCE_DIR/etc/glance-artifacts.conf $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF DEFAULT debug $ENABLE_DEBUG_LOG_LEVEL inicomment $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF DEFAULT log_file iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF database connection $dburl iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF keystone_authtoken identity_url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF keystone_authtoken admin_tenant_name $SERVICE_TENANT_NAME iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF keystone_authtoken admin_user glance iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF keystone_authtoken admin_password $SERVICE_PASSWORD iniset $GLANCE_API_CONF DEFAULT known_stores "glance.store.filesystem.Store, glance.store.http.Store, glance.store.swift.Store" if is_service_enabled s-proxy; then iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF DEFAULT default_store swift iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF DEFAULT swift_store_auth_address $KEYSTONE_SERVICE_URI/v2.0/ iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF DEFAULT swift_store_user $SERVICE_TENANT_NAME:glance-swift iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF DEFAULT swift_store_key $SERVICE_PASSWORD iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF DEFAULT swift_store_create_container_on_put True else iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF DEFAULT default_store file iniset $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_CONF DEFAULT filesystem_store_datadir $GLANCE_IMAGE_DIR/ fi cp -p $GLANCE_DIR/etc/glance-artifacts-paste.ini $GLANCE_ARTIFACTS_PASTE_INI run_process g-artifacts "$GLANCE_BIN_DIR/glance-artifacts --config-file=$GLANCE_CONF_DIR/glance-artifacts.conf" stop_process g-artifacts

commit_message:
Remove FIXED_RANGE route when unstacking

Unstacking with the unstack.sh script then running stack.sh again will
throw an error if a route already exists for the $FIXED_RANGE

Change-Id: Iea095a6387c142519706e4c00d6798a403f49449
Closes-Bug: #1423020

commit_message:
Use clouds.yaml

We've got a clouds.yaml with the creds, use it.

Change-Id: I8515871fb83e2e197761d1f0ec9cc63dc1ac6c56
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/90/195790/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Update/create user clouds.yaml file. # clouds.yaml will have # - A `devstack` entry for the `demo` user for the `demo` project. # - A `devstack-admin` entry for the `admin` user for the `admin` project. # The location is a variable to allow for easier refactoring later to make # it overridable. There is currently no usecase where doing so makes sense, # so it's not currently configurable. CLOUDS_YAML=~/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml mkdir -p $(dirname $CLOUDS_YAML) CA_CERT_ARG='' if [ -f "$SSL_BUNDLE_FILE" ]; then CA_CERT_ARG="--os-cacert $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE" fi $TOP_DIR/tools/update_clouds_yaml.py \ --file $CLOUDS_YAML \ --os-cloud devstack \ --os-region-name $REGION_NAME \ --os-identity-api-version $IDENTITY_API_VERSION \ $CA_CERT_ARG \ --os-auth-url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI/v$IDENTITY_API_VERSION \ --os-username demo \ --os-password $ADMIN_PASSWORD \ --os-project-name demo $TOP_DIR/tools/update_clouds_yaml.py \ --file $CLOUDS_YAML \ --os-cloud devstack-admin \ --os-region-name $REGION_NAME \ --os-identity-api-version $IDENTITY_API_VERSION \ $CA_CERT_ARG \ --os-auth-url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI/v$IDENTITY_API_VERSION \ --os-username admin \ --os-password $ADMIN_PASSWORD \ --os-project-name admin export OS_CLOUD=devstack-admin
deleted_lines: export OS_AUTH_URL=$SERVICE_ENDPOINT export OS_TENANT_NAME=admin export OS_USERNAME=admin export OS_PASSWORD=$ADMIN_PASSWORD export OS_REGION_NAME=$REGION_NAME# Update/create user clouds.yaml file. # clouds.yaml will have # - A `devstack` entry for the `demo` user for the `demo` project. # - A `devstack-admin` entry for the `admin` user for the `admin` project. # The location is a variable to allow for easier refactoring later to make it # overridable. There is currently no usecase where doing so makes sense, so # it's not currently configurable. CLOUDS_YAML=~/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml mkdir -p $(dirname $CLOUDS_YAML) CA_CERT_ARG='' if [ -f "$SSL_BUNDLE_FILE" ]; then CA_CERT_ARG="--os-cacert $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE" fi $TOP_DIR/tools/update_clouds_yaml.py \ --file $CLOUDS_YAML \ --os-cloud devstack \ --os-region-name $REGION_NAME \ --os-identity-api-version $IDENTITY_API_VERSION \ $CA_CERT_ARG \ --os-auth-url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI/v$IDENTITY_API_VERSION \ --os-username demo \ --os-password $ADMIN_PASSWORD \ --os-project-name demo $TOP_DIR/tools/update_clouds_yaml.py \ --file $CLOUDS_YAML \ --os-cloud devstack-admin \ --os-region-name $REGION_NAME \ --os-identity-api-version $IDENTITY_API_VERSION \ $CA_CERT_ARG \ --os-auth-url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI/v$IDENTITY_API_VERSION \ --os-username admin \ --os-password $ADMIN_PASSWORD \ --os-project-name admin

commit_message:
Remove legacy special-cases

This patch set removes legacy special-cases.
Because as dtroyer says, we can remove legacy special-cases after
is_XXX_enabled() are implemented, and these functions are
already implemented.

 * is_nova_enabled
 * is_cinder_enabled
 * is_ceilometer_enabled
 * is_glance_enabled
 * is_ironic_enabled
 * is_neutron_enabled
 * is_trove_enabled
 * is_swift_enabled

Closes-Bug: #1469160
Change-Id: Ic861dd62b665b4eedb3b62060c6182f61cce26b4

commit_message:
remove dependency of glance config file

Glance will stop tracking sample configuration files, see patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/195150/
this patch removes the code which copy sample configuration files
from source directory.

To keep consistency, this patch extract all non-default settings
from current glance sample configuration files, except the options
which will be overwriten later.

Change-Id: I0ca87384cbd94f98c98bfb2dfb53281b5fbbfb8e
Related-Bug: #1411836

commit_message:
Enable pipefail

Enable pipefail so we notice when intermediate commands fail.

This includes a couple of work-around for failing cases.

It is probably arguable that

 $ echo "foo" | grep " bar " | ... do something

is a false-positive of pipefail, if "do something" can handle a blank
string.  I think that the benefit of pipefail outweighs it and you can
write the same thing better in other ways.

Note some overalap with [1] which is where we first discovered these
issues.  Keeping this as a separate thing from the keystone v3 changes
though.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186682

Change-Id: If2daad2f233f80dc274603a3f1dac2260bd00ea6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/92/197792/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -o pipefail

commit_message:
Make dhcp broadcast configurable

Adds a configuration option for dhcp_reply_broadcast in
/etc/neutron/dhcp_conf.ini.

Closes Bug: 1456402

Change-Id: I86a45b5465ce8aa7b7d4a1533ec830a3698f3853
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/69/184169/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Enables user to configure whether or not to broadcast # DHCP replies. For some tunneling technologies (e.g. VXLAN) broadcast # is required in order for VM to receive the DHCP response. Q_DHCP_BROADCAST_REPLY=${$Q_DHCP_BROADCAST_REPLY:-False} iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT dhcp_broadcast_reply "$Q_DHCP_BROADCAST_REPLY"

commit_message:
simplifying the offline collect and compress

changing from using django-admin to just using the manage.py in the
horizon tree to simplify. This method is more reliable and matches the
horizon workflow better.

Change-Id: Id9454f28943df41cf0de7dfb35b8a9517051c9f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/50/209550/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Perform offline collection and compression of static files ( cd $HORIZON_DIR python manage.py collectstatic --noinput python manage.py compress --force )
deleted_lines: # Setup alias for django-admin which could be different depending on distro local django_admin if type -p django-admin > /dev/null; then django_admin=django-admin else django_admin=django-admin.py fi DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=openstack_dashboard.settings $django_admin collectstatic --noinput DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=openstack_dashboard.settings $django_admin compress --force

commit_message:
Add an option to tell tempest the availablity of metadata service

METADATA_SERVICE_AVAILABLE=False to disable metadata tests.
True by default.  The default is chosen to match with the
corresponding tempest option.

This option is intended to be used for gate.

Change-Id: I109339aa38aa095d7add7211858e90de8106a255
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/76/208776/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute-feature-enabled metadata_service ${METADATA_SERVICE_AVAILABLE:-False}

Change-Id: I87a5b560285d4520faa3c58968343f15abfc480f
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-07 14:16:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/78c0352f62370e2287df94ef550f67d3a40a4fc9', 'message': 'Enable Glance metadata catalog feature

Glances Metadata Definitions catalog is a common API hosted by the Glance service for vendors, admins, services, and users to meaningfully define available key / value pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for OpenStack users.

This feature was added in Juno.

commit_message:
Enable Glance metadata catalog feature

Glances Metadata Definitions catalog is a common API hosted by the Glance
service for vendors, admins, services, and users to meaningfully define
available key / value pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better
metadata collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for OpenStack
users.

This feature was added in Juno.

See: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/glance/glancemetadefcatalogapi.html

Related to commit https://review.openstack.org/193264
Change-Id: I87a5b560285d4520faa3c58968343f15abfc480f

subject: Change output filed number from "nova floating-ip-create" for IP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 23:43:34.000000000', 'files': ['exercises/floating_ips.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/8122c84486ef593990bebfd8fef4d4df7d94f6ec', 'message': 'Change output filed number from "nova floating-ip-create" for IP

The existing floating_ips.sh script fails when run on a freshly
installed devstack with an error similar to the following:

[Call Trace]
./floating_ips.sh:158:die
[ERROR] ./floating_ips.sh:158 Failure adding floating IP 1 to ex-float

It appears that the code expected the IP address in the first field,
whereas "nova floating-ip-create" returns an ID in the first field and
an IP in the second field. The simplest fix seemed to be to have the
field parser choose the correct field based on current nova output.

This patch changes "get_field 1" to "get_field 2" for the two
"nova floating-ip-create" commands.

Change-Id: Ibcbb06fbd761b88a4869fc583d23d96cc9debc81
'}]
commit_message:
Change output filed number from "nova floating-ip-create" for IP

The existing floating_ips.sh script fails when run on a freshly
installed devstack with an error similar to the following:

[Call Trace]
./floating_ips.sh:158:die
[ERROR] ./floating_ips.sh:158 Failure adding floating IP 1 to ex-float

It appears that the code expected the IP address in the first field,
whereas "nova floating-ip-create" returns an ID in the first field and
an IP in the second field. The simplest fix seemed to be to have the
field parser choose the correct field based on current nova output.

This patch changes "get_field 1" to "get_field 2" for the two
"nova floating-ip-create" commands.

Change-Id: Ibcbb06fbd761b88a4869fc583d23d96cc9debc81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/94/227594/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FLOATING_IP=$(nova floating-ip-create | grep $DEFAULT_FLOATING_POOL | get_field 2) TEST_FLOATING_IP=$(nova floating-ip-create $TEST_FLOATING_POOL | grep $TEST_FLOATING_POOL | get_field 2)
deleted_lines: FLOATING_IP=$(nova floating-ip-create | grep $DEFAULT_FLOATING_POOL | get_field 1) TEST_FLOATING_IP=$(nova floating-ip-create $TEST_FLOATING_POOL | grep $TEST_FLOATING_POOL | get_field 1)

commit_message:
Allow installing python-pip from the package

When python-pip is installed by https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py
into CentOS7, there is a case in which it does not move.

The python-pip, which is provided from the distributor or the like, it
can be used more stable. By upgrading to the latest version by the
capability provided in itself, it becomes possible to use the latest
version more stably.

Therefore, install_pip.sh is modified so that you can install python-pip
from the package provided by the distribution and so on.

Change-Id: Iae94a205cedbd0ca4030a16244e8dfc1612ee0e3
Closes-Bug: #1501284
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/84/213684/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: INSTALL_PIP_VERSION=${INSTALL_PIP_VERSION:-"1.4.1"} PIP_VERSION=''# Allow installing python-pip from the package provided by the Distribution. if [[ ${PIP_VERSION} == '' ]]; then # Try to install distributed pip package install_package python-pip get_versions fi if [[ ${PIP_VERSION} != '' ]]; then INSTALL_PIP_VERSION=$( ( echo "${INSTALL_PIP_VERSION}"; echo "${PIP_VERSION}" ) | awk -F. \ '{ if(NR<=1 || $1 > MAJOR || ($1 == MAJOR && ($2 > MINOR || ($2 == MINOR && (0 + gensub(/[^0-9].*$/, "", "g", $3) > REVISION || (0 + gensub(/[^0-9].*$/, "", "g", $3) == REVISION && $0 > FULLVER)))))) { FULLVER=$0; MAJOR=$1; MINOR=$2; REVISION=0 + gensub(/[^0-9].*$/, "", "g", $3); }} END { print FULLVER; }') if [[ ${PIP_VERSION} != ${INSTALL_PIP_VERSION} ]]; then # Do pip # Eradicate any and all system packages uninstall_package python-pip install_get_pip fi fi
deleted_lines: # Do pip # Eradicate any and all system packages uninstall_package python-pip install_get_pip

commit_message:
Add support for devstack with-reviews

Initial patch with addes the base functions needed
to lookup the gerrit project and ref given a change number.

Co-Authored-By: Uberjay
Change-Id: I963c8e6da5d5738b7d59e8e8f70e0c27e2cc3e9b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/30/240430/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # **inc/gerrit** - Gerrit-related functions # # Support for Gerrit patch related functions # # External functions used: # - GetOSVersion # - is_fedora # - is_suse # - safe_chown # Save trace setting INC_GERRIT_TRACE=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace # Gerrit Functions # ================ UPSTREAM_REMOTE=https://review.openstack.org # Get the gerrit patchset ref for a given change number # patchset_ref function base_patchset_ref { local change_num=$1 local patchset_ref=refs/changes/${change_num:(-2)}/$change_num echo $patchset_ref } # fetch latest patchset from gerrit # given the project and change number # latest_patchset function latest_patchset_ref { local change_num=$1 local project=$2 local patchset_ref=$(base_patchset_ref $change_num) local ref=$(git ls-remote $UPSTREAM_REMOTE/$project $patchset_ref/\* | sort -t/ -k 5 -n | tail -n1 | cut -d$'\t' -f2) echo $ref } # Restore xtrace $INC_GERRIT_TRACE # Local variables: # mode: shell-script # End:

commit_message:
Adding memcached install for Horizon

The session size requirements in Horizon have eclipsed the 4K limit
that signed cookies allow. This is especially true when horizon is
paired with keystone v3. This change is to make sure memcached is
available as a session store for horizon.

Change-Id: I1263a7f7e74c78d27dede65d6b4db74e4567cdde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/11/193611/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # horizon uses memcached as the session store install_package memcached if is_ubuntu; then install_package python-memcache else install_package python-memcached fi

commit_message:
Grant nova service user only service role

The 'admin' role gives the 'nova' user authority to perform all
sorts of operations on keystone that the 'nova' user doesn't need
to do. The 'nova' user should have only the 'service' role.

This is for security hardening

Change-Id: I32765604fb61e3c2a9cf53fcd6a293ab1a1131a0
Closes-Bug: #1445199
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/22/175222/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # SERVICE_TENANT_NAME nova admin # NOTE(jamielennox): Nova doesn't need the admin role here, however neutron uses # this service user when notifying nova of changes and that requires the admin role. create_service_user "nova" "admin"

commit_message:
neutron-legacy: Add an explicit knob to enable instance metadata

If Q_METADATA_ENABLED is set to True, configure nova metadata proxy
even if q-meta is disabled.  This allows Neutron backends provide
their alternative implementations.

Here's an example of such an implementation:
https://github.com/midonet/midonet/blob/master/docs/openstack-metadata.md

Change-Id: I32cbae1eb6b642b8106e24d9e76ba87b11b24cbe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/28/211028/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Provide instance metadata service Q_METADATA_ENABLED=${Q_METADATA_ENABLED:-False} if [[ "$Q_METADATA_ENABLED" == "True" ]]; then Q_METADATA_ENABLED=True
deleted_lines: if is_service_enabled q-meta; then

commit_message:
Add support for wily

Add support for Ubuntu 15.10 aka wily werewolf.

commit_message:
Add openstack-libery repo to rdo-release-liberty

Modify stack.sh environment 2 variable which set in
[[epel-bootstrap]] RHEL_RDO_REPO_RPM and RHEL_RDO_REPO_ID
to support Devstack's branch stable/liberty when install
devstack on Centos 7.1

Change-Id: I3cf026f4513b1c70f3e3585909bc9d92cbe5abd6

commit_message:
Support user images

When deploy ironic in the baremetal system, we need provide user kernel,
ramdisk and images. This patch add support to this, so that when
IRNOC_HARDWARE is true, these user disks will be uploaded to glance.

Change-Id: I69452b86f1f4eec4cb169923f978cc1bd1ac45b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/72/127672/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$IRONIC_HARDWARE" == "True" ]]; then declare -g IRONIC_USR_KERNEL_ID IRONIC_USR_RAMDISK_ID IRONIC_USR_KERNEL_ID=$(openstack \ --os-token $token \ --os-url http://$GLANCE_HOSTPORT \ image create \ $(basename $IRONIC_USR_KERNEL_PATH) \ --public --disk-format=aki \ --container-format=aki \ < $IRONIC_USR_KERNEL_PATH | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) IRONIC_USR_RAMDISK_ID=$(openstack \ --os-token $token \ --os-url http://$GLANCE_HOSTPORT \ image create \ $(basename $IRONIC_USR_RAMDISK_PATH) \ --public --disk-format=ari \ --container-format=ari \ < $IRONIC_USR_RAMDISK_PATH | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) IRONIC_USR_DISK_ID=$(openstack \ --os-token $token \ --os-url http://$GLANCE_HOSTPORT \ image create \ $(basename $IRONIC_USR_DISK_PATH) \ --public --disk-format=qcow2 \ --container-format=bare \ --property ramdisk_id=$IRONIC_USR_RAMDISK_ID \ --property kernel_id=$IRONIC_USR_KERNEL_ID \ < $IRONIC_USR_DISK_PATH | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) fi

commit_message:
Adds neutron linuxbridge-agent support to ironic deployment.

When the Neutron Agent is set to 'linuxbridge', instead of the default
'openvswitch', the baremetal nodes created in libvirt will use bridge
 networking instead of an openvswitch virtualport.

Change-Id: I4bce73368aca8e3954bd7088ddd46b319c6458cd
Closes-Bug: #1327046

subject: Reset no_proxy when the node is installed behind a proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-30 17:13:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/173345c44606c5073520c50b1906cc5fe8641049', 'message': 'Reset no_proxy when the node is installed behind a proxy

Closes-Bug: 1291111/1322200

Problem:
=======
When devstack is installed behind a proxy with proxy variables
like http_proxy and https_proxy exported and without no_proxy
set, the installation will fail. The reason is that any REST
request sent to Keystone will be redirected to the proxy server.

Solution:
========
Fix involves appending no_proxy variable with localhost,HOST_IP,
FLOATING_RANGE and FIXED_RANGE if they are not included and
exporting the variable.

Change-Id: If65cb282adc6f5e4c4507b1422885d81de3da4e8

commit_message:
Reset no_proxy when the node is installed behind a proxy

Closes-Bug: 1291111
Closes-Bug: 1322200

Problem:
=======
When devstack is installed behind a proxy with proxy variables
http_proxy and https_proxy being exported and without exporting
no_proxy, the installation will fail. The reason is that any REST
request sent to Keystone will be redirected to the proxy server.

Solution:
========
Fix involves appending no_proxy variable with localhost,HOST_IP,
SERVICE_HOST if they are not included already and then exporting
the variable.

Change-Id: If65cb282adc6f5e4c4507b1422885d81de3da4e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/85/117985/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Start ir-api after ir-cond
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-16 13:05:34.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/71895197eb38747683c24bcb86a704a2e2d39d4a', 'message': "Start ir-api after ir-cond

In spirit of the work toward rolling upgrades in Ironic, we plan to
begin remoting database calls from the API to the conductor.

In devstack, nova-compute starts before the Ironic processes and begins
polling the API service for resources. If the API service directs DB
calls to the conductor, there is a small window in which the API is up
before the conductor is up, and the API will send a bunch of calls over
the message queue that won't get replies.

Start the conductor service before the API service, so that it's ready
and waiting for calls from the API.

Change-Id: I8a0d92f5b158418f391bc9a0c37f116b529bc967
"}]
commit_message:
Start ir-api after ir-cond

In spirit of the work toward rolling upgrades in Ironic, we plan to
begin remoting database calls from the API to the conductor.

In devstack, nova-compute starts before the Ironic processes and begins
polling the API service for resources. If the API service directs DB
calls to the conductor, there is a small window in which the API is up
before the conductor is up, and the API will send a bunch of calls over
the message queue that won't get replies.

Start the conductor service before the API service, so that it's ready
and waiting for calls from the API.

Change-Id: I8a0d92f5b158418f391bc9a0c37f116b529bc967
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/05/235905/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Start Ironic API server, if enabled. if is_service_enabled ir-api; then start_ironic_api fi
deleted_lines: # Start Ironic API server, if enabled. if is_service_enabled ir-api; then start_ironic_api fi

commit_message:
Add support for dib based agent ramdisk in lib/ironic

This commit adds support for building and configuring
dib based agent ramdisk for Ironic. The environment
variable IRONIC_IPA_RAMDISK_DISTRO
can be used to mention the preferred distro to build the
ramdisk.

By default, lib/ironic will continue building coreos
based IPA ramdisk. "fedora" and "ubuntu" are supported
values for IRONIC_IPA_RAMDISK_DISTRO.

Change-Id: I55ab7be6fc1f9ba7dc41e53d7d8fc3e951aaf8d4
Closes-Bug: 1510797
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/55/239855/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IRONIC_IPA_RAMDISK_DISTRO=${IRONIC_IPA_RAMDISK_DISTRO:-coreos}function build_ipa_ramdisk { local kernel_path=$1 local ramdisk_path=$2 if [ "$IRONIC_IPA_RAMDISK_DISTRO" = "coreos" ]; then build_ipa_coreos_ramdisk $kernel_path $ramdisk_path elif [[ "$IRONIC_IPA_RAMDISK_DISTRO" = "fedora" || "$IRONIC_IPA_RAMDISK_DISTRO" = "ubuntu" ]]; then build_ipa_dib_ramdisk $kernel_path $ramdisk_path $IRONIC_IPA_RAMDISK_DISTRO else echo "IRONIC_IPA_RAMDISK_DISTRO=$IRONIC_IPA_RAMDISK_DISTRO is not supported." fi } function build_ipa_coreos_ramdisk { echo "Building coreos ironic-python-agent deploy ramdisk"function build_ipa_dib_ramdisk { local kernel_path=$1 local ramdisk_path=$2 local distro=$3 local tempfile=$(mktemp) echo "Building $distro ironic-python-agent deploy ramdisk" disk-image-create -a amd64 \ -o "$tempfile" \ "$distro" ironic-agent mv "${tempfile}.kernel" "$kernel_path" mv "${tempfile}.initramfs" "$ramdisk_path" rm -f "$tempfile" } build_ipa_ramdisk $IRONIC_DEPLOY_KERNEL_PATH $IRONIC_DEPLOY_RAMDISK_PATH
deleted_lines: function build_ipa_coreos_ramdisk { echo "Building ironic-python-agent deploy ramdisk" build_ipa_coreos_ramdisk $IRONIC_DEPLOY_KERNEL_PATH $IRONIC_DEPLOY_RAMDISK_PATH

commit_message:
[IRONIC] Config variable to configure [glance] section

This commit adds a new config variable
IRONIC_CONFIGURE_GLANCE_WITH_SWIFT, which can be
set to True to configure the Swift related config
parameters of [glance] section in ironic.conf.

Change-Id: Idfbd7c1f7d6ca36b8db0d10259827145c449f99c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/84/244584/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # To explicitly enable configuration of Glance with Swift # (which is required by some vendor drivers), set this # variable to true. IRONIC_CONFIGURE_GLANCE_WITH_SWIFT=$(trueorfalse False IRONIC_CONFIGURE_GLANCE_WITH_SWIFT) function is_glance_configuration_required { is_deployed_by_agent || [[ "$IRONIC_CONFIGURE_GLANCE_WITH_SWIFT" == "True" ]] && return 0 return 1 } if is_glance_configuration_required; then die $LINENO "SWIFT_ENABLE_TEMPURLS must be True. This is " \ "required either because IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER was " \ "set to some agent_* driver OR configuration of " \ "Glance with Swift was explicitly requested with " \ "IRONIC_CONFIGURE_GLANCE_WITH_SWIFT=True" fi if is_deployed_by_agent; then
deleted_lines: if is_deployed_by_agent; then die $LINENO "SWIFT_ENABLE_TEMPURLS must be True to use agent_ssh driver in Ironic."

Set 'public_endpoint' and 'admin_endpoint' keystone configuration
parameters to use 'https' after enabling 'tls-proxy' service.
If these parameters are not set after enabling 'tls-proxy' service,

Closes-Bug: #1482574

commit_message:
Fix keystone configuration for 'tls-proxy' service

Set 'public_endpoint' and 'admin_endpoint' keystone configuration
parameters to use 'https' after enabling 'tls-proxy' service.
If these parameters are not set after enabling 'tls-proxy' service,
then default value is getting used which is http://server:5000.
This needs to be https://server:5000 after enabling 'tls-proxy'.

Change-Id: If6fd02351b1a8be925cc5bb3f28339e2a6f54cd1
Closes-Bug: #1482574
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/98/210298/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set public_endpoint and admin_endpoint iniset $KEYSTONE_CONF DEFAULT public_endpoint "$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST:$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PORT/" iniset $KEYSTONE_CONF DEFAULT admin_endpoint "$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST:$KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT/"

commit_message:
EPEL has not been released for ppc64le until RHEL7.2

EPEL has not been built yet for the ppc64le architecture.  It should
exist for the release of RHEL 7.2.  Therefore do not install it here.
Rather rely on it already being installed for the instances where a
private repository exists.

Change-Id: I834f20e9ceae151788cec3649385da1274d7ba46
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/74/243274/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # EPEL has not been released for the ppc64le architecture until RHEL7.2+ # So disable once a number of conditions have been met. Use nested ifs in order to # make it clearer. epel_bootstrap_needed=true if is_arch ppc64le; then # NOTE: Bash does not handle floating point comparisons. Use bc instead! if [[ $(echo "if (${os_RELEASE} <= 7.1) 1 else 0" | bc) -eq 1 ]]; then epel_bootstrap_needed=false fi fi fi if is_fedora && [[ $DISTRO == "rhel7" ]] && ${epel_bootstrap_needed}; then

commit_message:
Enable ssh validation for Neutron

The 'run_validation' flag is 'False' by default and because of that
some tests that require ssh validation are skipped.
This patch sets the flag to 'True' if Neutron is enabled (and Ironic is
disabled).

Related-Bug: #1507926
Change-Id: I97e7be15855193427146efe0acd03ca0939214c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/18/235118/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG validation run_validation ${TEMPEST_RUN_VALIDATION:-True}
deleted_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG validation run_validation ${TEMPEST_RUN_VALIDATION:-False}

commit_message:
Add support for provider network in tempest

This commit adds support for using provider network
in tempest if it's desired by the user of devstack.
It changed network_for_ssh and fixed_network_name in
[compute] to the PHYSICAL_NETWORK specified by the user.

Closes-Bug: 1510780
Change-Id: Id2c05c8a696c4d2df231f888571867ed2f2fbb62
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/29/174729/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "$Q_USE_PROVIDER_NETWORKING" == "True" ]; then iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute network_for_ssh $PHYSICAL_NETWORK else iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute network_for_ssh $PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME fi if [ "$Q_USE_PROVIDER_NETWORKING" == "True" ]; then iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute fixed_network_name $PHYSICAL_NETWORK else iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute fixed_network_name $PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME fi
deleted_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute network_for_ssh $PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute fixed_network_name $PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME

subject: WIP: Just a test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-08 05:42:36.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/1384b4dc4745ab8228d615f797ed5910f36411aa', 'message': "WIP: Just a test

Fix SIGITIN hang with apt-get

Fix an issue where apt-get consistently hangs due to a SIGTTIN being
received. This occurs on a 'vanilla' devstack-gate VM, when running an
ironic-grenade job.

Upstream has a bug related to this:
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=555632

http://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Job-Control-Signals.html
Macro: int SIGTTIN

    A process cannot read from the user's terminal while it is running
    as a background job. When any process in a background job tries to
    read from the terminal, all of the processes in the job are sent a
    SIGTTIN signal. The default action for this signal is to stop the
    process. For more information about how this interacts with the
    terminal driver, see Access to the Terminal.

Change-Id: I769bba2041a75b5c895816f5c22ddde08927bf62
Closes-Bug: #1532080
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Just a test

Fix SIGITIN hang with apt-get

Fix an issue where apt-get consistently hangs due to a SIGTTIN being
received. This occurs on a 'vanilla' devstack-gate VM, when running an
ironic-grenade job.

Upstream has a bug related to this:
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=555632

http://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Job-Control-Signals.html
Macro: int SIGTTIN

    A process cannot read from the user's terminal while it is running
    as a background job. When any process in a background job tries to
    read from the terminal, all of the processes in the job are sent a
    SIGTTIN signal. The default action for this signal is to stop the
    process. For more information about how this interacts with the
    terminal driver, see Access to the Terminal.

Change-Id: I769bba2041a75b5c895816f5c22ddde08927bf62
Closes-Bug: #1532080
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/80/265080/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: apt-get --option "Dpkg::Options::=--force-confold" --option "Dpkg::Options::=--force-confdef" --assume-yes "$@" < /dev/null
deleted_lines: apt-get --option "Dpkg::Options::=--force-confold" --assume-yes "$@"

commit_message:
Remove m2crypto from nova rpms

We haven't used m2crypto in a while now.

Change-Id: Ic60a06b142612de8f72e00d15624cce1116b7b5f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 04:42:21.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/198525bab1e4bff4433fce075605c12178304111', 'message': 'Don't redeclare DEST|DATA_DIR|SERVICE_DIR in stack.sh

DEST should be configured by stackrc (which should be created after
local config is sourced, ergo picking up any redirection).  Remove the
redeclaration here, and die if it is not already set.

Similar for DATA_DIR

SERVICE_DIR, introduced in I845f6b5dddce5cffa7165ec58517f9ae5d8632a6,
has never been explicitly created; it gets created when there's a
"mkdir -p" for individual components later.  Add a similar check &
creation as the other two just for consistency.

Change-Id: I13c80f62389e841ffce5e0dc8a69b685690d68f3
'}]
commit_message:
Don't redeclare DEST|DATA_DIR|SERVICE_DIR in stack.sh

DEST should be configured by stackrc (which should be created after
local config is sourced, ergo picking up any redirection).  Remove the
redeclaration here, and die if it is not already set.

Similar for DATA_DIR

SERVICE_DIR, introduced in I845f6b5dddce5cffa7165ec58517f9ae5d8632a6,
has never been explicitly created; it gets created when there's a
"mkdir -p" for individual components later.  Add a similar check &
creation as the other two just for consistency.

Change-Id: I13c80f62389e841ffce5e0dc8a69b685690d68f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/34/245634/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create the destination directory and ensure it is writable by the # user and read/executable by everybody for daemons (e.g. apache run # for horizon) if [[ -z "$DEST" ]]; then die $LINENO "DEST is unset! Have you broken stackrc?" fiif [[ -z "$DATA_DIR" ]]; then die $LINENO "DATA_DIR is unset! Have you broken stackrc?" fi# Destination path for service status files if [[ -z "$SERVICE_DIR" ]]; then die $LINENO "SERVICE_DIR is unset! Have you broken stackrc?" fi sudo mkdir -p $SERVICE_DIR safe_chown -R $STACK_USER $SERVICE_DIR
deleted_lines: # Destination path for installation ``DEST`` DEST=${DEST:-/opt/stack} # Create the destination directory and ensure it is writable by the user # and read/executable by everybody for daemons (e.g. apache run for horizon)DATA_DIR=${DATA_DIR:-${DEST}/data}

commit_message:
Add subunit output to the timing infrastructure

This commit adds writing a subunit file to the timing infrastructure
in devstack. This means in addition to printing to stdout at the end
of a run, there will be a subunit stream available at the end of the
run which will contain all the individual timing data which can be
used for trend analysis with a subunit2sql db or visualized with
stackviz.

Change-Id: I4591cad7f353e070d21218843bad2f762870df21

commit_message:
Set DATA_DIR and SERVICE_DIR correctly

Set DEST variable after soucing local.conf so that DATA_DIR and
SERVICE_DIR which depends on DEST would be set correctly to
${DEST}/data and ${DEST}/status rather than /opt/stack/data and
/opt/stack/status.

Change-Id: I05060c7b9789ab628f5279839e2152fb4f33621d

commit_message:
Wrong usage of "a/an"

Wrong usage of "a/an" in the mesages:
"generating a accounts.yaml for running with test-accounts"
"Checks for a specific password defined for an user"
"Example for an username johndoe"

Should be:
"generating an accounts.yaml for running with test-accounts"
"Checks for a specific password defined for a user"
"Example for a username johndoe"

Totally 3 occasions in Devstack base code.

Change-Id: Ia2dfd1bddb596380c39270ad337bdeb6b128309e

commit_message:
Don't create a seperate venv for verify-tempest-config

This commit switches the lib/tempest code to not create a seperate venv
just for calling verify-tempest-config. Instead it will use the venv
created for running the full tox job. This saves us from having to
create 2 separate venvs.

Change-Id: I26ec701f3a0a793595311e06bdb345a94a80ccd5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/27/171627/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: tox -revenv -- verify-tempest-config -uro $tmp_cfg_file

commit_message:
Expose right identity API version and auth type

The generated userrc files, such as accrc/admin/admin, have
fixed v2password OS_AUTH_TYPE, and contains no REGION
environment variable. This patch outputs these information
into userrc files.

In addition, add an script to clear OS_* environment
viariables.

Closes-bug: 1514372
Change-Id: Ie9b484d0b757c5ee2720dcf6070bf89debb58995
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/02/243002/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "$ENABLE_IDENTITY_V2" == "False" ]; then OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 else OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=2.0 fi export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=${OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION} export OS_AUTH_TYPE=password
deleted_lines: export OS_AUTH_TYPE=v2password

commit_message:
Support SSL client certificate generation

This is the plumbing needed to support SSL mutual authentication and
eventually tokenless authz. Will submit another patch to complete the
loop once we have the x.509 auth plugin implemented in keystoneauth.

Change-Id: I85c69dd087d12972134341c260ad72eb8f28ec15

commit_message:
download requirements repo a single time

The install_infra command already downloads the requirements_repo, so it
does not make sense to add a command to download it in the stack.sh file
just before invoking install_infra.

Instead of duplicating the work, we can just postpone the installation
of os-testr after installing infra.

Change-Id: Iacf5d192054496bbdb579535bcc378583485145c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/32/275632/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NEVER USE pip_install_gr BEFORE THIS POINT # Install subunit for the subunit output stream pip_install_gr os-testr
deleted_lines: # Bring down global requirements before any use of pip_install. This is # necessary to ensure that the constraints file is in place before we # attempt to apply any constraints to pip installs. git_clone $REQUIREMENTS_REPO $REQUIREMENTS_DIR $REQUIREMENTS_BRANCH # Install subunit for the subunit output stream pip_install_gr os-testr

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-30 12:46:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/1e7e79e90d6f9c98494f807bd7e191ea683f4b76', 'message': "Skip pxelinux binary setup in Ironic for ppc arch

Power architecture has its own embeded bootloader, petitboot, and thus
it doesn't require or uses pxelinux.0 as x86 does so we just skip its

Change-Id: If1a880f298a17ef53c5417243535841d48369e80
"}]
commit_message:
Skip pxelinux binary setup in Ironic for ppc arch

Power architecture has its own embeded bootloader, petitboot, and thus
it doesn't require or uses pxelinux.0 as x86 does so we just skip its
setup in that case.
In fact pxelinux.0 doesn't have a version for ppc architecture.

Change-Id: If1a880f298a17ef53c5417243535841d48369e80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/38/251338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(maurosr): When the target node's architecture is ppc* we don't need # pxelinux binary cause petitboot plays the bootloader role. if [[ ! "$IRONIC_HW_ARCH" =~ ppc ]]; then if [ ! -f $IRONIC_PXE_BOOT_IMAGE ]; then die $LINENO "PXE boot file $IRONIC_PXE_BOOT_IMAGE not found." fi # Copy PXE binary if [[ "$IRONIC_IPXE_ENABLED" == "True" ]] ; then cp $IRONIC_PXE_BOOT_IMAGE $IRONIC_TFTPBOOT_DIR else # Syslinux >= 5.00 pxelinux.0 binary is not "stand-alone" anymore, # it depends on some c32 modules to work correctly. # More info: http://www.syslinux.org/wiki/index.php/Library_modules cp -aR $(dirname $IRONIC_PXE_BOOT_IMAGE)/*.{c32,0} $IRONIC_TFTPBOOT_DIR fi
deleted_lines: if [ ! -f $IRONIC_PXE_BOOT_IMAGE ]; then die $LINENO "PXE boot file $IRONIC_PXE_BOOT_IMAGE not found." fi # Copy PXE binary if [[ "$IRONIC_IPXE_ENABLED" == "True" ]] ; then cp $IRONIC_PXE_BOOT_IMAGE $IRONIC_TFTPBOOT_DIR else # Syslinux >= 5.00 pxelinux.0 binary is not "stand-alone" anymore, # it depends on some c32 modules to work correctly. # More info: http://www.syslinux.org/wiki/index.php/Library_modules cp -aR $(dirname $IRONIC_PXE_BOOT_IMAGE)/*.{c32,0} $IRONIC_TFTPBOOT_DIR

commit_message:
WIP: Change service domain name

A test to see how many services freak out if the service user is not
in the default domain any more.

Is a configurable option so will never be merged in this form.

Change-Id: Ic041f779fbc086836c8f75cc998d8907a5280a46

commit_message:
"Operation not permitted" failure in unstack.sh

pkill returns "Operation not permitted" failure in unstack.sh.
I add this command to 'sudo'.

Change-Id: I28e86fe33ae66de351b3352356d2244e5f145454
Closes-Bug: #1504904

commit_message:
Get root password for build image from settings

Image building process reads from settings hashed version of root
password and apply it instead of default.

Change-Id: Ibb614ddd1973c8fae25dae8217d207ffc92f1b15
Partial-Bug: #1537496
Depends-On: I2092bfca78fb721a8df3c8c6e4e6fd18e64ba353

added_lines: root_password = self.driver.data.get('hashed_root_password') force_ipv4_file=CONF.force_ipv4_file, root_password=root_password) root_password = self.driver.data.get('hashed_root_password') force_ipv4_file=CONF.force_ipv4_file, root_password=root_password)
deleted_lines: force_ipv4_file=CONF.force_ipv4_file) force_ipv4_file=CONF.force_ipv4_file)

revisions:

This change adds a debug line which indicates which mgmt partition uuid

commit_message:
Include debug of mgmt partition uuid on driver

This change adds a debug line which indicates which mgmt partition uuid
was used.

Change-Id: I799ccb84fbcd8588aa477a37641964fe32238ad2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/42/293442/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug("Driver found compute partition UUID of: %s" % self.mp_uuid)

commit_message:
Improve output of --json option

Indent the output of commands when using the --json option. This patch
is a follow-up patch for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/283519/

Change-Id: Ieb3ffd8c362b37ad9b78bd3ecd98499b26c03bd0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/56/289256/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add a --json option to the client to display the JSON response body from the Ironic API without formatting it.

commit_message:
Fix logrotate tests

In order for logrotate command to return 0 exit status we could
call it without -f key for the first time.

subject: Allow l3 agent RPC worker to create HA network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 18:50:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5a32e55fe96f28aa85847d1dd8a4dfe53517a0a2', 'message': 'Allow l3 agent RPC worker to create HA network

L3 agent RPC worker assumes that ha_network is already created by API
worker on router create. But if API worker is dead after creating router
in DB, l3 agent RPC worker fails to get HA network. Another case is,
if RPC woker tries to get HA network before it is created by API
worker, it will fail. This change allows RPC worker to create HA network
if not created.

Change-Id: I43757b9d2e51ccc7163f250d79209ddc51739af5
'}]
commit_message:
Allow l3 agent RPC worker to create HA network

L3 agent RPC worker assumes that ha_network is already created by API
worker on router create. But if API worker is dead after creating router
in DB, l3 agent RPC worker fails to get HA network. Another case is,
if RPC woker tries to get HA network before it is created by API
worker, it will fail. This change allows RPC worker to create HA network
if not created.

Change-Id: I43757b9d2e51ccc7163f250d79209ddc51739af5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/62/294762/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Explicitly delete network from L3HARouterNetwork
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 15:24:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/da678c550156ea1ea74ac68eea2c99513da998d7', 'message': 'Explicitly delete network from L3HARouterNetwork

Delete network from L3HARouterNetwork if no router exists.

While deleting HA network from "networks" table, it deletes
network entry in L3HARouterNetwork as part of CASCADE delete operation.

But with this, we may have failures in below scenario
(with multiple workers)
1) delete_router called on worker1. worker1 finds no HA router and calls
   delete HA network(but HA network not yet deleted from
   L3HARouterNetwork table and "networks" table)
2) woker2 created a new HA router and this router succefully checked
   for network in L3HARouterNetwork(but yet to create ports)
3) worker1 deleted HA network from L3HARouterNetwork(as part of CASCADE
   operation) and "networks" tables
4) worker2 is trying to create HA interfaces and fails

If we explicitly deleted network from L3HARouterNetwork immediately
after the check for deletion(step 1), it will force routers created
after that(i.e step 2) to create new HA network.
And these routers will use this new HA network and avoid failures.

Change-Id: I2c8da4cda96c1132ceccaf524001b362f58fcbe5

Change-Id: I2c8da4cda96c1132ceccaf524001b362f58fcbe5

commit_message:
Explicitly delete network from L3HARouterNetwork

Delete network from L3HARouterNetwork if no router exists.

While deleting HA network from "networks" table, it deletes
network entry in L3HARouterNetwork as part of CASCADE delete operation.

But with this, we may have failures in below scenario
(with multiple workers)
1) delete_router called on worker1. worker1 finds no HA router and calls
   delete HA network(but HA network not yet deleted from
   L3HARouterNetwork table and "networks" table)
2) woker2 created a new HA router and this router succefully checked
   for network in L3HARouterNetwork(but yet to create ports)
3) worker1 deleted HA network from L3HARouterNetwork(as part of CASCADE
   operation) and "networks" tables
4) worker2 is trying to create HA interfaces and fails

If we explicitly deleted network from L3HARouterNetwork immediately
after the check for deletion(step 1), it will force routers created
after that(i.e step 2) to create new HA network.
And these routers will use this new HA network and avoid failures.

Change-Id: I2c8da4cda96c1132ceccaf524001b362f58fcbe5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/72/294672/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use correct pcs resource name for rabbitmq-server resource

1) introduce additional pacemaker helper to get correct resource
name for multi-state resources
2) alter strength tests to use the correct name

Change-Id: Ibe97e2d7cadf475354e1ed77b41deff6faf68151
Closes-bug: #1551708

    , where '212' is a decimal hash of ENV_NAME and DATABASES, so there

  is *stopped*, then a new network can be created using the same CIDR

  on the same host, making possible to share the same routed baremeta

commit_message:
Allow create DB-independed libvirt networks

- use an unique prefix for bridge/interface names:
    fuel212br1:    # bridges of libvirt networks
    fuel212br1-nic:
    fuel212br2:
    fuel212br2-nic:
    fuel212br3:
    fuel212br3-nic:
    ...
    fuel212net1    # a guest's interfaces
    fuel212net2
    fuel212net3
    fuel212net4
    fuel212net5
    , where '212' is a decimal hash of ENV_NAME and DATABASES, so there
    will be a high chance to get an unique prefix for different envs or
    different databases.

    For bridges, LIBVIRT_BR_PREFIX can be specified instead of
    the prefix 'fuelNNNbr'.

    For interfaces, LIBVIRT_IF_PREFIX can be specified instead of
    the prefix 'fuelNNNnet'.

- check if a CIDR is already used in libvirt before creating
  a libvirt network; pick another CIDR if it is used.
  For example, there is already created network 'test_env_admin' with
  CIDR 10.109.0.0/24

  If 'export REUSE_NETWORK_POOLS=False' (default), then for a new
  libvirt network will be created another CIDR than the existing
  10.109.0.0/24.

  If 'export REUSE_NETWORK_POOLS=True' *and* the network'test_env_admin'
  is *stopped*, then a new network can be created using the same CIDR
  10.109.0.0/24 for different devops environment.
  Thus, the same CIDR can be re-used for several environments located
  on the same host, making possible to share the same routed baremeta
  CIDR between different environments, for example.

Change-Id: I7695c5d1a93b5f642543352876e57d209f4db02e
Implements: blueprint fuel-devops-multiple-databases

commit_message:
determine tgtd ready status through tgtadm

The intention of the iscsi extension _wait_for_iscsi_daemon function
is to wait till the tgtd process boots completely before running any
iscsi commands through the tgtadm command line utility.  The tgtd
process utilises a unix socket for communication with the user and the
_wait_for_iscsi_daemon function asserts the tgtd process status based
on the socket presence.  The socket name/path to use is not specified
by iscsi extension configuration but rather falls-back to a
(system-wide) default value[1].  Since tgtd version 1.0.60, this path
changed from /var/run/tgtd.ipc_abstract_namespace to
/var/run/tgtd/socket[2] and now causes a false-negative while waiting
for the tgtd process to boot[3].

This patch follows implementation suggestion from the bug report[3] to
avoid relying on the socket presence but rather to check the tgtd
status by trying to communicate through the tgtadm tool.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic-python-agent/blob/
5bbb9ded082f2cfde5e8877e9f33294eb93a5fb7/
ironic_python_agent/extensions/iscsi.py#L47 [2]
https://github.com/fujita/tgt/commit/
d1aa4dcfd691c9409dbad5db49ce6754ce9c1b5a
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-python-agent/+bug/1505923

Closes-Bug: #1505923
Partial-Bug: #1551250
Depends-On: I4c19c96d2d5cd8accb9ed8df6241fc9f0c229e0e
Change-Id: If3284e0b441fe6c2da507640c08a4bbefd9dad2b
(cherry-picked from commit fb920f41ed181c7ec74e3367f2735bccce07e574)

commit_message:
More documentation on writing i9n tests

List of topics:
* go_to_<pagename>page() methods and proper file structure is covered
* regions facilities
* customizing gate environment
* running tests in plugins

Change-Id: I885705b62e63b72c5ba823a8ebf7be20f9fcddbe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/21/272121/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: case for the "good" failures. Writing your first integration test =================================== So, you are going to write your first integration test and looking for some guidelines on how to do it. The first and the most comprehensive source of knowledge is the existing codebase of integration tests. Look how other tests are written, which Page Objects they use and learn by copying. Accurate imitation eventually will lead to a solid understanding. Yet there are few things that may save you some time when you know them in advance. File and directory layout and go_to_*page() methods --------------------------------------------------- horizon/ |- openstack_dashboard/ |- test/ |- integration_tests/ |- pages/ |- admin/ | |- __init__.py | |- system/ | |- __init__.py | |- flavorspage.py |- project/ | |- compute/ | |- __init__.py | |- access_and_security/ | | |- __init__.py | | |- keypairspage.py | |- imagespage.py |- navigation.py |- regions/ |- tests/ |- config.py |- horizon.conf New tests themselves are put into integration_tests/tests, where they are grouped by the kind of entities being tested (test_instances.py, test_networks.py, etc). All Page Objects to be used by tests are inside pages/ directory, the nested directory structure you see within it obeys the value of `Navigation.CORE_PAGE_STRUCTURE` you can find at pages/navigation.py module. The contents of `CORE_PAGE_STRUCTURE` variable should in turn mirror the structure of standard dashboard sidebar menu. If this condition is not met, go_to_<pagename>page() methods which are generated automatically at runtime will have problems matching the real sidebar items. How are these go_to_*page() methods are generated? From the sidebar's point of view, dashboard content could be at most 4 levels deep, considering the hierarchy Dashboard / Panel Group / Panel / Tab. Given the mixture of these entities in existing dashboards, it was decided that: * When panels need to addressed with go_to_*page() methods, 2 components in method's name are enough for distinguishing the right path to go along, namely a Panel name and a Panel Group name (or a Dashboard name, if no Panel Group exists above Panel). For example, `go_to_system_flavorspage()` method to go to Admin->System->Flavors and `go_to_identity_projectspage()` method to go to Identity->Projects panel. * When we need to go one level deeper, i.e. go to the specific TableTab on any panel that has several tabs, 3 components are enough - Panel Group, Panel and Tab names. For example, `go_to_compute_accessandsecurity_floatingipspage()` for navigating to Project->Compute->Access & Security->Floating IPs tab. Note that one cannot navigate to a Panel level if that Panel has several tabs (i.e., only terminal levels could be navigated to). As you might have noticed, method name components are choosen from normalized items of `CORE_PAGE_STRUCTURE` dictionary, where normalization means replacing spaces with `_` symbol and `&` symbol with `and`, then downcasing all symbols. Once `go_to_*page()` method's name is parsed and the proper menu item is matched in a dashboard, it should return the proper Page Object. For that to happen a properly named class should reside in a properly named module located in the right place of the filesystem. More specifically and top down: # Page Object class is located in: ** <dashboard>/<panel_group>/<panel>page.py file for non-tabbed pages ** <dashboard>/<panel_group>/<panel>/<tab>page.py file for tabbed pages Values <dashboard>, <panel_group>, <panel> and <tab> are the normalized versions of the items from `CORE_PAGE_STRUCTURE` dictionary. # Within the above module a descendant of `basepage.BaseNavigationPage` should be defined, its name should have the form <Panel>Page or <Tab>Page, where <Panel> and <Tab> are capitalized version of normalized <panel> and <tab> items respectively. Reusable regions ---------------- * TableRegion <TBD> * FormRegion <TBD> * MessageRegion <TBD> Customizing tests to a specific gate environment ------------------------------------------------ * horizon.conf / config.py <TBD> * tools/gate/integration scripts <TBD> Writing integration tests for Horizon plugins --------------------------------------------- <TBD>
deleted_lines: case for the "good" failures.

added_lines: :command:`ps aux` and all of the sudden the instance locked up.lock-up. I logged into the new instance and ran :command:`ps aux` again. It worked. Phew. I decided to run it one more time. It locked up. Not all packets have a size of 1500. Running the :command:`ls` command over However, running a command with heavy output, such as :command:`ps aux`project. We used the :option:`-s` option of ``ping`` to change the packet size. We watched as sometimes packets would fully return, sometimes they'd only make it out and never back in, and sometimes the packets would stop at a.. code-block:: console $ ip a  10: vlan100@vlan20: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc noqueue master br100 state UP .. code-block:: console $ grep vlan_interface /etc/nova/nova.conf vlan_interface=vlan20.. code-block:: ini vlan_interface=bond0#. Instance tries to renew IP. #. Cloud controller receives the renewal request and sends a response. #. Instance "ignores" the response and re-sends the renewal request. #. Cloud controller receives the second request and sends a new#. Instance begins sending a renewal request to ``255.255.255.255``#. The cloud controller receives the ``255.255.255.255`` request and#. The instance finally gives up.The :command:`nova reboot` command wasn't working, so I used :command:`virsh`, but it immediately came back with an error saying it was unable to find theentries for the file that :command:`virsh` is reporting: .. code-block:: console dair-ua-c03/nova.log:Dec 19 12:10:59 dair-ua-c03 2012-12-19 12:10:59 INFO nova.virt.libvirt.imagecache [-] Removing base file: /var/lib/nova/instances/_base/7b4783508212f5d242cbf9ff56fb8d33b4ce6166_10.. code-block:: console $nova-manage service list.. code-block:: console Feb 15 01:40:18 SW-1 Stp: %SPANTREE-4-BLOCK_BPDUGUARD: Received BPDU packet on Port-Channel35 with BPDU guard enabled. Disabling interface. (source mac fa:16:3e:24:e7:22) Feb 15 01:40:18 SW-1 Ebra: %ETH-4-ERRDISABLE: bpduguard error detected on Port-Channel35. Feb 15 01:40:18 SW-1 Mlag: %MLAG-4-INTF_INACTIVE_LOCAL: Local interface Port-Channel35 is link down. MLAG 35 is inactive. Feb 15 01:40:18 SW-1 Ebra: %LINEPROTO-5-UPDOWN: Line protocol on Interface Port-Channel35 (Server35), changed state to down Feb 15 01:40:19 SW-1 Stp: %SPANTREE-6-INTERFACE_DEL: Interface Port-Channel35 has been removed from instance MST0 Feb 15 01:40:19 SW-1 Ebra: %LINEPROTO-5-UPDOWN: Line protocol on Interface Ethernet35 (Server35), changed state to down.. code-block:: console adm@cc12:/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-00000e05# wc -l console.log 92890453 console.log adm@cc12:/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-00000e05# ls -sh console.log 5.5G console.logOutput from ``/var/log/nova/nova-api.log`` on :term:`Havana`: .. code-block:: console 2014-01-10 09:11:45.072 129745 INFO nova.ec2.wsgi.server [req-84d16d16-3808-426b-b7af-3b90a11b83b0 0c6e7dba03c24c6a9bce299747499e8a 7052bd6714e7460caeb16242e68124f9] 117.103.103.29 "GET /services/Cloud?AWSAccessKeyId=[something]&Action=RunInstances&ClientToken=[something]&ImageId=ami-00000001&InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior=terminate... Add link to Neutron devref upgrading document

The developer reference for the networking service has
content about upgrading the service, so let's link it.

commit_message:
Fixes/updates packages for manila share node and some steps/notes.

Manila-share packages are already available for rdo and obs. For
ubuntu is expected to be provided for mitaka RC1.
This patch also fixes some steps and add some notes considering
releases prior to RC1.

Closes-Bug: #1557536

Change-Id: Id9ae51540de5258ea93247ace20e89f0dacb1f34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/26/293126/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # zypper install openstack-manila-share # yum install openstack-manila-share # apt-get install manila-share # systemctl enable openstack-manila-share.service # systemctl start openstack-manila-share.service # systemctl enable openstack-manila-share.service # systemctl start openstack-manila-share.service
deleted_lines: # zypper install openstack-manila python-PyMySQL # yum install openstack-manila targetcli python-oslo-policy # apt-get install manila-common python-pymysql # systemctl enable openstack-manila-volume.service tgtd.service # systemctl start openstack-manila-volume.service tgtd.service # systemctl enable openstack-manila-share.service target.service # systemctl start openstack-manila-share.service target.service

commit_message:
Container sync nodes shuffle cleanup

Since commit "Update container sync to use internal client" get_object is
done using internal_client and not directly on nodes which makes the block
of code to shuffle the nodes redundant.

Change-Id: I45a6dab05f6f87510cf73102b1ed191238209efe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/77/294077/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

get_topic method was added to the LogicalRouterPort
Object but topic was not added to the db obj.
Considering that we are planning to move the

Change-Id: I690cfafc75f312c62a9af131f39c7bf75869213a
Closes-Bug: #1560115
'}]
commit_message:
Add topic to the router port

get_topic method was added to the LogicalRouterPort
Object but topic was not added to the db obj.
Considering that we are planning to move the
router port to there own table the topic was added
to the router port and was not taken from the
router object

Change-Id: I690cfafc75f312c62a9af131f39c7bf75869213a
Closes-Bug: #1560115
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/82/295482/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: lrouter_port['topic'] = topic

commit_message:
Add DHCP applicative testing

Add an applicative testing where a DHCP client gets an IP automatically.

Change-Id: I8360350c31dd1af6587ada5bdb5ab67d1d88b12b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/96/291196/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Taken from the DHCP app def _get_dhcp_message_type_opt(dhcp_packet): for opt in dhcp_packet.options.option_list: if opt.tag == ryu.lib.packet.dhcp.DHCP_MESSAGE_TYPE_OPT: return ord(opt.value) class RyuDHCPFilter(object): """Use ryu to parse the packet and test if it's a DHCP Ack""" def __call__(self, buf): pkt = ryu.lib.packet.packet.Packet(buf) return (pkt.get_protocol(ryu.lib.packet.dhcp.dhcp) is not None) class RyuDHCPPacketTypeFilter(object): """Use ryu to parse the packet and test if it's a DHCP Ack""" def __call__(self, buf): pkt = ryu.lib.packet.packet.Packet(buf) dhcp = pkt.get_protocol(ryu.lib.packet.dhcp.dhcp) if not dhcp: return False return _get_dhcp_message_type_opt(dhcp) == self.get_dhcp_packet_type() def get_dhcp_packet_type(self): raise Exception('DHCP packet type filter not fully implemented') class RyuDHCPOfferFilter(RyuDHCPPacketTypeFilter): def get_dhcp_packet_type(self): return ryu.lib.packet.dhcp.DHCP_OFFER class RyuDHCPAckFilter(RyuDHCPPacketTypeFilter): def get_dhcp_packet_type(self): return ryu.lib.packet.dhcp.DHCP_ACK

subject: Keep row 'data-display' attr up to date after inline editing a cell
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-11 11:22:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/fb47878145b5457a43752f7aad2cde60afce3155', 'message': "Keep row 'data-display' attr up to date after inline editing a cell

Attribute 'data-display' is used to display warning pop-ups about
destructive actions to table rows. Thus if not updated properly after
editing row entity names inline, it will lead to confirm modal message
being outdated.

Change-Id: I4bbedfce60782230cbfbb7262877ce926753aa66
Closes-Bug: #1481850

commit_message:
Keep row 'data-display' attr up to date after inline editing a cell

Attribute 'data-display' is used to display warning pop-ups about
destructive actions to table rows. Thus if not updated properly after
editing row entity names inline, it will lead to confirm modal message
being outdated.

Change-Id: I4bbedfce60782230cbfbb7262877ce926753aa66
Closes-Bug: #1481850

commit_message:
Fix conversion of config disks to qcow2 during resize/migration

finish_migration contains some code which converts raw disks to qcow2
when moving from a host which uses raw disks to a host which uses
qcow2 disks. This was erroneously also converted config disks, which
are hard-coded to be raw even when other disks are qcow2.

This has always been broken, but it wasn't previously exposed because
a subsequent bug unconditionally overwrote the qcow2 config disk with
a new, raw one. Change I03e08fae97416ebe5cdedcf238a06d1b90203c5d
changed the order of these 2 events, so that the erroneously-converted
config drive was no longer overwritten, resulting in a qcow2 file
being presented to the instance as raw.

This change explicitly filters out config disks from conversion.

Change-Id: I6bf3cd4f9e0e152bf69732d9a17f93c86dedbd40
Closes-Bug: #1558343
(cherry picked from commit 29fb0aca1623eb0c4a565d728501667a4c5e8136)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/295229/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _disk_info(type='qcow2', config_disk=False): disk_info = [{'disk_size': 1, 'type': type, {'disk_size': 1, 'type': type, if config_disk: disk_info.append({'disk_size': 1, 'type': 'raw', 'virt_disk_size': 1024, 'path': '/test/disk.config'}) self.drvr._disk_size_from_instance(inst, 'disk')) self.drvr._disk_size_from_instance(inst, 'disk.local')) self.drvr._disk_size_from_instance(inst, 'disk.swap')) # Source disks are raw to test conversion disk_info = self._disk_info(type='raw', config_disk=True) with mock.patch.object(self.drvr, '_disk_raw_to_qcow2', autospec=True) as mock_raw_to_qcow2: self.drvr.finish_migration( context.get_admin_context(), migration, ins_ref, disk_info, [], image_meta, resize_instance, None, power_on) # Assert that we converted the root and swap disks convert_calls = [mock.call('/test/disk'), mock.call('/test/disk.swap')] mock_raw_to_qcow2.assert_has_calls(convert_calls, any_order=True) # Implicitly assert that we did not convert the config disk self.assertEqual(len(convert_calls), mock_raw_to_qcow2.call_count)
deleted_lines: def _disk_info(): disk_info = [{'disk_size': 1, 'type': 'qcow2', {'disk_size': 1, 'type': 'qcow2', info = {'path': '/path/disk'} self.drvr._disk_size_from_instance(inst, info)) info = {'path': '/path/disk.local'} self.drvr._disk_size_from_instance(inst, info)) info = {'path': '/path/disk.swap'} self.drvr._disk_size_from_instance(inst, info)) self.drvr.finish_migration( context.get_admin_context(), migration, ins_ref, self._disk_info(), [], image_meta, resize_instance, None, power_on)

commit_message:
Make node count check a validation

Make the check that runs to verify there are sufficient Ironic nodes a
proper validation. As a validation, it will be affected by the
--validation-errors-nonfatal cli arg, which will allow the deployment to
continue when specified.

This is useful for various testing and devlopment scenarios.

Change-Id: I6acc26d36017577dd0de73458dff24d5cb57024d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/06/232106/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _update_parameters(self, args, network_client, stack): parameters = self._update_parameters( def _predeploy_verify_capabilities(self, parsed_args, stack, parameters): self._check_nodes_count(stack, parameters) def _check_nodes_count(self, stack, parameters): try: utils.check_nodes_count( self.app.client_manager.tripleoclient.baremetal(), stack, parameters, { 'ControllerCount': 1, 'ComputeCount': 1, 'ObjectStorageCount': 0, 'BlockStorageCount': 0, 'CephStorageCount': 0, } ) except exceptions.DeploymentError as e: self.log.error("Error checking node count.") self.log.exception(e) self.predeploy_errors += 1 clients = self.app.client_manager orchestration_client = clients.tripleoclient.orchestration() network_client = clients.network stack = self._get_stack(orchestration_client, parsed_args.stack) stack_create = stack is None if stack_create: self.log.info("No stack found, will be doing a stack create") else: self.log.info("Stack found, will be doing a stack update") parameters = self._update_parameters( parsed_args, network_client, stack) errors, warnings = self._predeploy_verify_capabilities( parsed_args, stack, parameters)
deleted_lines: def _update_paramaters(self, args, network_client, stack): parameters = self._update_paramaters( utils.check_nodes_count( self.app.client_manager.tripleoclient.baremetal(), stack, parameters, { 'ControllerCount': 1, 'ComputeCount': 1, 'ObjectStorageCount': 0, 'BlockStorageCount': 0, 'CephStorageCount': 0, } ) def _predeploy_verify_capabilities(self, parsed_args): """Setup before the Heat stack create or update has been done.""" errors, warnings = self._predeploy_verify_capabilities(parsed_args) clients = self.app.client_manager orchestration_client = clients.tripleoclient.orchestration() stack = self._get_stack(orchestration_client, parsed_args.stack) stack_create = stack is None if stack_create: self.log.info("No stack found, will be doing a stack create") else: self.log.info("Stack found, will be doing a stack update")

subject: Make hypervisor stat check a validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-07 14:41:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/6e868f3582313916bb73c6937767e28e9a2ea4bd', 'message': "Make hypervisor stat check a validation

The check to make sure there are sufficient hypervisors registered with
enough statistics to handle the deployment is a validation and should be
treated as such.

Note that is a default change in behavior since
--validation-errors-fatal defaults to False. Previously, this check
would have aborted the deployment. Now that it's a validation, it won't
since that cli arg is defaulted to False. It may make better sense to
have --validation-errors-fatal default to True as part of this change as
well. I'll wait for feedback on that to see what folks think.

Change-Id: I0f5caa767fc11caea6bf563241accefd56c509b7
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-07 15:18:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/339359b5f024dd8445fd3eef985fb66b3d028951', 'message': "Make hypervisor stat check a validation

enough statistics to handle the deployment is a validation and should be
treated as such.

Note that is a default change in behavior since
--validation-errors-fatal defaults to False. Previously, this check
would have aborted the deployment. Now that it's a validation, it won't
since that cli arg is defaulted to False. It may make better sense to
have --validation-errors-fatal default to True as part of this change as
well. I'll wait for feedback on that to see what folks think.

commit_message:
Make hypervisor stat check a validation

The check to make sure there are sufficient hypervisors registered with
enough statistics to handle the deployment is a validation and should be
treated as such.

Change-Id: I0f5caa767fc11caea6bf563241accefd56c509b7

commit_message:
openstack-doc-tools 0.34.0

This release is needed for Mitaka, it includes some changes for our
tools to support the mitaka release in other projects. It also updates
our build environment for our target manuals.

Adding missing mitaka releases

A number of tags were pushed for mitaka deliverables without
updating the corresponding openstack/releases file. This fixes
the situation.

commit_message:
Tacker was not part of the Liberty release

Tacker was only recently added to OpenStack -- its first release
will be in the Mitaka cycle. We should not have it listed as part
of the liberty release (and probably shouldn't have officially
announced its recent stable release).

Change-Id: I4f693b95c0eeb9561550e4e1be655a4f4d157560

commit_message:
Support python3 in simulator.py

Tested with:
python3 simulator.py --url \
    rabbit://stackrabbit:flopsymopsy@localhost:5672/ notify-server
python3 simulator.py --url \
    rabbit://stackrabbit:flopsymopsy@localhost:5672/ notify-client -m 1000

and:
python3 simulator.py --url \
    rabbit://stackrabbit:flopsymopsy@localhost:5672/ rpc-server
python3 simulator.py --url \
    rabbit://stackrabbit:flopsymopsy@localhost:5672/ rpc-client -m 1000

Change-Id: I1f8bb964aef23867a651e192dc355635e36f78a1
