commit_message:
Add start_index property for RG resource indexes

This adds a new property start_index for the RG resources with
the default being 0.

Change-Id: Icbd651764d72c23313df92971b70b7e61cfaefa9

commit_message:
Restrict SSH according the security settings

* Bind SSH service on the all interfaces by default
* Restrict SSH access only on ssh_network from the fuelmenu

Change-Id: I3c5f7e931669d9d28f59d9f64b4d407b2f37215e
Depends-on: I2d1149a7596d596f581b7628de7089ac375772f6
Depends-on: I6518923c089a0f602566394bc4502a57c4306eb7
Depends-on: I9609003d892875b0bbe00d24fe8365edb1f3c57e
Closes-Bug: #1557190

commit_message:
Fix sysfs service idempotency

Sysfs is kind of "apply params" service, so status should always
return true. Service's resource will prefer the 'status' parameter,
then 'statuscmd' method, then look in the process table.

Partial-Bug: #1524724
Change-Id: I8a13ac4a227195cfb16be89c8fb0a9a9ec3ba1f0

commit_message:
Add unit tests for NFV-related functions

Add unit tests for the following functions:
- nic_whitelist_to_json
- nic_whitelist_to_mappings
- filter_nodes_with_enabled_option

Closes-bug: #1557974

Change-Id: Ia50c0e50d360b7557b19df3661ed980d8726c8c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/01/294901/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'nic_whitelist_to_json' do let(:scope) { PuppetlabsSpec::PuppetInternals.scope } let(:nic_whitelist) do [{"devname"=>"eth1", "physical_network"=>"physnet2"}] end let(:nic_whitelist_json) do "[{\"devname\":\"eth1\",\"physical_network\":\"physnet2\"}]" end before(:each) do puppet_debug_override() end it 'should exist' do expect(Puppet::Parser::Functions.function('nic_whitelist_to_json')).to eq('function_nic_whitelist_to_json') end it 'should fail if more then one argument given' do expect{scope.function_nic_whitelist_to_json([nic_whitelist, 'eee'])}.to raise_error(Puppet::ParseError, /one argument is allowed/) end it 'should return without arguments' do expect(scope.function_nic_whitelist_to_json([])).to eq(nil) end it 'should convert nic whitelist to json' do expect(scope.function_nic_whitelist_to_json([nic_whitelist])).to eq(nic_whitelist_json) end end

commit_message:
Add release notes for metadata api

Change-Id: Id93d052621dec5c468edb6b197101f75a89cd112
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/72/294272/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > The Mitaka release includes a new API to add arbitrary metadata to Secrets. upgrade: - The Metadata API requires an update to the Database Schema. Existing deployments that are being upgraded to Mitaka should use the 'barbican-manage' utility to update the schema.

commit_message:
Add unit tests for agent and RT type driver

Add unit tests for bagpipe-bgp agent and for
the Route Target type driver.

Also disable VXLAN on Linux Bridge to fix tests, by avoiding
the local_ip not set check.
(cherry-picked from commit: ba553add9106f14d06f56b6244e8ba70c17f17f2)
This needs to be squashed into this change, or else the
new unit tests do not pass.

Co-Author: Yannick Thomas <ythomas1.ext@orange.com>

Change-Id: I52e74ae99b704b9d73b2198e62f9900a83b88cc8
(cherry picked from commit 3af8326f9ad9de8687348c3d6ee8a0f6a3ce654f)

Add Designate & Zaqar roles to OpenStack-Ansible Project

This patch updates governance for new repositories implemented
in the OpenStack-Ansible Project which implements Designate and
Zaqar as part of an OpenStack environment.

Depends-On: Icd3810574b72f98da8f51c26e46c527bdd89680b

commit_message:
Fix port detach message not send when a port is migrated

Check if a port is bound to a segment only when its status has passed
to ACTIVE state on new host

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: I4b9de27ee151608d26001fe647d9713503accd5f
Closes-Bug: 1526724
(cherry picked from commit 7ac5e8aa3940cce1aae99f54ec5ea3456a0f07b6)

commit_message:
Modify agent: handle multiple port attach sources

This is needed to support, for instance, E-VPN parameters
to be contributed to by the ML2 mech_driver and by the
BGPVPN service plugin.

Other changes in this refactoring:
- Modify BGP VPN port attach handling.
- No need to specify notifiers and vpn types on attach,
  re-sending all plugs for each ports.
- Unplug all notifiers port informations on port detach.

Co-Author: Yannick Thomas <ythomas1.ext@orange.com>
Change-Id: Ifcc2c42c2fcb67762c18aed9bb0b01f0c665967e
(cherry picked from commit c9a03ffbb5946fc5e2ab73047b6a1d142eca102d)

Detach BGP VPN port from BaGPipe BGP component LOG.debug("Detaching BGP VPN port %s from BaGPipe BGP component", index, _ = self._get_reg_attachment_for_port(net_uuid, port_id) self._do_local_port_bgpvpn_unplug(net_uuid, index) self._remove_reg_attachment_for_index(net_uuid, index) except BGPAttachmentNotFound as e: LOG.error("Can't detach BGP VPN port from BaGPipe BGP " "component: %s", str(e))

commit_message:
Add version request object

We are adding a version request object for the control of API
micro-versions. The design is borrowed from both nova project and the
openstack-specs guideline.

Partial-bp: api-microversioning
Change-Id: I9a038c8132b25b6518350ab391155f28ccf1c573

commit_message:
Reorg unit tests for API

This patch reorganizes the unit tests for senlin API. The directory
layout mimics that of the modules to be tested. This makes room for
future patches where we are adding new version of APIs etc.

Change-Id: Ifc544a8fd6b7245da99bc5229f20a57962405198

commit_message:
Validate the number of DNS nameservers

User should not be able to specify more than 5 DNS nameservers per
subnet.

Change-Id: I89024f10aa139302437c486b1eea770582a14336
Closes-Bug: #1555471
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/98/291098/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: var maxNameservers = 5; errors.push(nameservers.length <= maxNameservers ? null : i18n('cluster_page.network_tab.validation.too_many_nameservers')); if (_.compact(errors).length) return {dns_nameservers: _.compact(errors)};
deleted_lines: if (_.compact(errors).length) return {dns_nameservers: errors};

subject: Reset the ovs nightly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-14 16:07:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/5298edea54a4d1b89c1c9c6ab875e96ab824510b', 'message': 'Reset the ovs nightly

Gracefully stop each testenv on a TE host then reset the ovs
config. The purpose here is to work around a ovs bug that is
now more prominent in our testenvs since increasing the number
of nicsa per testenv.

commit_message:
Reset the ovs nightly

Gracefully stop each testenv on a TE host then reset the ovs
config. The purpose here is to work around a ovs bug that is
now more prominent in our testenvs since increasing the number
of nicsa per testenv.

Change-Id: Ib437c0bf4c5eb716e812e654c8f223ced8564a2f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/80/292480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Not including set -e here as we always want to finish up by starting # ovs and the testenvs regardless of what happens. set -x # Gracfully stop all envs /usr/local/bin/testenv-ctl stop_jobs # Wait for upto 3 hours for the envs to finish processing for x in $(seq 180) ; do if [ $(virsh list --name | grep seed_ | wc -l) == 0 ] ; then systemctl stop openvswitch cp /etc/openvswitch/conf.db_testenv /etc/openvswitch/conf.db systemctl start openvswitch break fi sleep 60 done /usr/local/bin/testenv-ctl start_jobs

commit_message:
Import code working with Ironic nodes from os_cloud_config

This patch introduces tripleo_common.utils.{glance,nodes} modules.
The glance one is imported with only import fixes (including importing
a private exceptions module from the glance client).

The nodes.py is a rewritten and fixed version taken from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/263309/. Main changes:
* Stop hardcoding flavor (e.g. agent, pxe) for each driver
* Support only generic properties with pm_* names. Driver-specific things
  should stay with their prefix. Existing pm_* driver-specific things
  were deprecated.
* Pass through everything that starts with driver-specific prefix to
  node's driver_info.
* Dropped handling Conflict exceptions - ironicclient is doing it for
  some time already (and does better job in it).
* Issue a specific exception for malformed instackenv.json.
* Optimize calls to ironic (use list with details instead of list+get)
* Use 'add' operation instead of 'replace', as it allows both adding
  and overwriting (despite its name).
* Fixed some small issues like adding a dict to a set.

Change-Id: I7efffc5c6627776a20fad4bf4cf266330c4b8b6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/23/291723/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import logging import re from ironicclient import exc as ironicexp import six from tripleo_common import exception from tripleo_common.utils import glance LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class DriverInfo(object): """Class encapsulating field conversion logic.""" DEFAULTS = {} def __init__(self, prefix, mapping, deprecated_mapping=None): self._prefix = prefix self._mapping = mapping self._deprecated_mapping = deprecated_mapping or {} def convert_key(self, key): if key in self._mapping: return self._mapping[key] elif key in self._deprecated_mapping: real = self._deprecated_mapping[key] LOG.warning('Key %s is deprecated, please use %s', key, real) return real elif key.startswith(self._prefix): return key elif key != 'pm_type' and key.startswith('pm_'): LOG.warning('Key %s is not supported and will not be passed', key) else: LOG.debug('Skipping key %s not starting with prefix %s', key, self._prefix) def convert(self, fields): """Convert fields from instackenv.json format to ironic names.""" result = self.DEFAULTS.copy() for key, value in fields.items(): new_key = self.convert_key(key) if new_key is not None: result[new_key] = value return result def unique_id_from_fields(self, fields): """Return a string uniquely identifying a node in instackenv.""" def unique_id_from_node(self, node): """Return a string uniquely identifying a node in ironic db.""" class PrefixedDriverInfo(DriverInfo): def __init__(self, prefix, deprecated_mapping=None, has_port=False, address_field='address'): mapping = { 'pm_addr': '%s_%s' % (prefix, address_field), 'pm_user': '%s_username' % prefix, 'pm_password': '%s_password' % prefix, } if has_port: mapping['pm_port'] = '%s_port' % prefix self._has_port = has_port super(PrefixedDriverInfo, self).__init__( prefix, mapping, deprecated_mapping=deprecated_mapping ) def unique_id_from_fields(self, fields): result = fields['pm_addr'] if self._has_port and 'pm_port' in fields: result = '%s:%s' % (result, fields['pm_port']) return result def unique_id_from_node(self, node): new_key = self.convert_key('pm_addr') assert new_key is not None try: result = node.driver_info[new_key] except KeyError: # Node cannot be identified return if self._has_port: new_port = self.convert_key('pm_port') assert new_port try: return '%s:%s' % (result, node.driver_info[new_port]) except KeyError: pass return result class SshDriverInfo(DriverInfo): DEFAULTS = {'ssh_virt_type': 'virsh'} def __init__(self): super(SshDriverInfo, self).__init__( 'ssh', { 'pm_addr': 'ssh_address', 'pm_user': 'ssh_username', # TODO(dtantsur): support ssh_key_filename as well 'pm_password': 'ssh_key_contents', }, deprecated_mapping={ 'pm_virt_type': 'ssh_virt_type', } ) class iBootDriverInfo(PrefixedDriverInfo): def __init__(self): super(iBootDriverInfo, self).__init__( 'iboot', has_port=True, deprecated_mapping={ 'pm_relay_id': 'iboot_relay_id', } ) def unique_id_from_fields(self, fields): result = super(iBootDriverInfo, self).unique_id_from_fields(fields) if 'iboot_relay_id' in fields: result = '%s#%s' % (result, fields['iboot_relay_id']) return result def unique_id_from_node(self, node): try: result = super(iBootDriverInfo, self).unique_id_from_node(node) except IndexError: return if node.driver_info.get('iboot_relay_id'): result = '%s#%s' % (result, node.driver_info['iboot_relay_id']) return result DRIVER_INFO = { # production drivers '.*_ipmi(tool|native)': PrefixedDriverInfo('ipmi'), '.*_drac': PrefixedDriverInfo('drac', address_field='host'), '.*_ilo': PrefixedDriverInfo('ilo'), '.*_ucs': PrefixedDriverInfo( 'ucs', address_field='hostname', deprecated_mapping={ 'pm_service_profile': 'ucs_service_profile' }), '.*_irmc': PrefixedDriverInfo( 'irmc', has_port=True, deprecated_mapping={ 'pm_auth_method': 'irmc_auth_method', 'pm_client_timeout': 'irmc_client_timeout', 'pm_sensor_method': 'irmc_sensor_method', 'pm_deploy_iso': 'irmc_deploy_iso', }), # test drivers '.*_ssh': SshDriverInfo(), '.*_iboot': iBootDriverInfo(), '.*_wol': DriverInfo( 'wol', mapping={ 'pm_addr': 'wol_host', 'pm_port': 'wol_port', }), '.*_amt': PrefixedDriverInfo('amt'), 'fake(|_pxe|_agent)': DriverInfo('fake', mapping={}), } def _find_driver_handler(driver): for driver_tpl, handler in DRIVER_INFO.items(): if re.match(driver_tpl, driver) is not None: return handler # FIXME(dtantsur): handle all drivers without hardcoding them raise exception.InvalidNode('unknown pm_type (ironic driver to use): ' '%s' % driver) def _find_node_handler(fields): try: driver = fields['pm_type'] except KeyError: raise exception.InvalidNode('pm_type (ironic driver to use) is ' 'required', node=fields) return _find_driver_handler(driver) def register_ironic_node(service_host, node, client=None, blocking=None): if blocking is not None: LOG.warning('blocking argument to register_ironic_node is deprecated ' 'and does nothing') driver_info = {} handler = _find_node_handler(node) if "kernel_id" in node: driver_info["deploy_kernel"] = node["kernel_id"] if "ramdisk_id" in node: driver_info["deploy_ramdisk"] = node["ramdisk_id"] driver_info.update(handler.convert(node)) mapping = {'cpus': 'cpu', 'memory_mb': 'memory', 'local_gb': 'disk', 'cpu_arch': 'arch'} properties = {k: six.text_type(node.get(v)) for k, v in mapping.items() if node.get(v) is not None} if 'capabilities' in node: properties.update({"capabilities": six.text_type(node.get('capabilities'))}) create_map = {"driver": node["pm_type"], "properties": properties, "driver_info": driver_info} if 'name' in node: create_map.update({"name": six.text_type(node.get('name'))}) node_id = handler.unique_id_from_fields(node) LOG.debug('Registering node %s with ironic.', node_id) ironic_node = client.node.create(**create_map) for mac in node.get("mac", []): client.port.create(address=mac, node_uuid=ironic_node.uuid) validation = client.node.validate(ironic_node.uuid) if not validation.power['result']: LOG.warning('Node %s did not pass power credentials validation: %s', ironic_node.uuid, validation.power['reason']) try: client.node.set_power_state(ironic_node.uuid, 'off') except ironicexp.Conflict: # Conflict means the Ironic conductor does something with a node, # ignore the exception. pass return ironic_node def _populate_node_mapping(client): LOG.debug('Populating list of registered nodes.') node_map = {'mac': {}, 'pm_addr': {}} nodes = client.node.list(detail=True) for node in nodes: for port in client.node.list_ports(node.uuid): node_map['mac'][port.address] = node.uuid handler = _find_driver_handler(node.driver) unique_id = handler.unique_id_from_node(node) if unique_id: node_map['pm_addr'][unique_id] = node.uuid return node_map def _get_node_id(node, handler, node_map): candidates = [] for mac in node.get('mac', []): try: candidates.append(node_map['mac'][mac.lower()]) except KeyError: pass unique_id = handler.unique_id_from_fields(node) if unique_id: try: candidates.append(node_map['pm_addr'][unique_id]) except KeyError: pass if len(candidates) > 1: raise exception.InvalidNode('Several candidates found for the same ' 'node data: %s' % candidates, node=node) elif candidates: return candidates[0] def _update_or_register_ironic_node(service_host, node, node_map, client=None): handler = _find_node_handler(node) node_uuid = _get_node_id(node, handler, node_map) if node_uuid: LOG.info('Node %s already registered, updating details.', node_uuid) patched = {} for field, path in [('cpu', '/properties/cpus'), ('memory', '/properties/memory_mb'), ('disk', '/properties/local_gb'), ('arch', '/properties/cpu_arch'), ('name', '/name'), ('capabilities', '/properties/capabilities')]: if field in node: patched[path] = node.pop(field) driver_info = handler.convert(node) for key, value in driver_info.items(): patched['/driver_info/%s' % key] = value node_patch = [] for key, value in patched.items(): node_patch.append({'path': key, 'value': six.text_type(value), 'op': 'add'}) ironic_node = client.node.update(node_uuid, node_patch) else: ironic_node = register_ironic_node(service_host, node, client) return ironic_node.uuid def _clean_up_extra_nodes(seen, client, remove=False): all_nodes = set([n.uuid for n in client.node.list()]) remove_func = client.node.delete extra_nodes = all_nodes - seen for node in extra_nodes: if remove: LOG.debug('Removing extra registered node %s.' % node) remove_func(node) else: LOG.debug('Extra registered node %s found.' % node) def register_all_nodes(service_host, nodes_list, client=None, remove=False, blocking=True, keystone_client=None, glance_client=None, kernel_name=None, ramdisk_name=None): LOG.debug('Registering all nodes.') node_map = _populate_node_mapping(client) glance_ids = {'kernel': None, 'ramdisk': None} if kernel_name and ramdisk_name: glance_ids = glance.create_or_find_kernel_and_ramdisk( glance_client, kernel_name, ramdisk_name) seen = set() for node in nodes_list: if glance_ids['kernel'] and 'kernel_id' not in node: node['kernel_id'] = glance_ids['kernel'] if glance_ids['ramdisk'] and 'ramdisk_id' not in node: node['ramdisk_id'] = glance_ids['ramdisk'] uuid = _update_or_register_ironic_node(service_host, node, node_map, client=client) seen.add(uuid) _clean_up_extra_nodes(seen, client, remove=remove)

"The HTTP path used in the HTTP request used by the monitor to test a member " "health. Gltige Werte sind Zeichenfolgen, die mit " "einem Schrgstrich (/) beginnen." msgid ""msgid "The ID of the pool to which the pool member belongs." msgstr "Die ID des Pools, zu der das Poolmitglied gehrt." administrative state of this listener." msgstr "Der Verwaltungsstatus dieses Listeners." msgid "The bay model name." msgstr "Der Name des Bay-Modells." msgid "The bay name." msgstr "Der Name der Bay." default cloud-init user set up for each image (e.g. "ubuntu" for " "Ubuntu 12.04+, "fedora" for Fedora 19+ and "cloud-user" for CentOS/RHEL " "6.5)." msgstr "" "Der Standardbenutzer fr 'cloud-init', Objekts." msgid "" "The gateway IP address. If " "remove this from template when update, the old gateway IP address will be " "detached." msgstr "" "Die Gateway-IP-Adresse. Setzen Sie einen beliebigen Wert [ null | ~ | " """ ], um ein Subnetz ohne Gateway zu erstellen/zu aktualisieren. Ohne " "Angabe eines Werts bei der Erstellung ordnet Neutron die erste freie IP-" "Adresse innerhalb des Subnetzes dem Gateway automatisch zu. Wird dies bei " "einer Aktualisierung aus der Vorlage entfernt, wird die alte Gateway-IP-" "Adresse abgehngt." msgid "The image name or UUID to use as a base image for this baymodel." msgstr "" "Der Abbildname oder die UUID, die als Basisabbild fr dieses Bay-Modell " "verwendet werden sollen." msgid "The input string to be stored." msgstr "Die zu speichernde Eingabezeichenfolge." msgid "The list of Pools related to this monitor." msgstr "Die Liste der Pools, die zu diesem Monitor gehren." msgid "" "The list of resource types to create. This list may contain type names or " "aliases defined in the resource registry. Specific template names are not " "supported." msgstr "" "Die Liste der zu erstellenden Ressourcentypen. Spezifische Vorlagennamen werden nicht untersttzt." msgid "" "The maximum number of connections permitted for this load balancer. Defaults " "to -1, which is infinite." msgstr "" "Die maximale Anzahl an Verbindungen, die fr diesen Loadbalancer zulssig " "sind. Nimmt standardmig den Wert -1 (unendlich) an." "The maximum number of seconds to wait for the resource to signal completion. " "Once the timeout is reached, creation of the signal resource will fail." msgstr "" "Die maximale Anzahl an Sekunden, die darauf gewartet wird, dass die " "Ressource Fertigstellung signalisiert. Bei Erreichen des Zeitlimits schlgt " "die Erstellung der Signalressource fehl." msgid ""msgid "The maximum transmission unit size(in bytes) for the network." msgstr "Die maximale Gre der bertragungseinheit (in Byte) fr das Netz." "The metric dimensions to match to the alarm dimensions. One or more " "dimension key names separated by a comma." msgstr "" "Die metrischen Dimensionen, die mit den Alarmdimensionen bereinstimmen " "mssen. Es muss mindestens ein Dimensionsschlssel angegeben werden. Mehrere " "Schlssel werden durch Kommas voneinander getrennt." msgid ""msgid "The name for the QoS policy." msgstr "Der Name fr die QoS-Richtlinie." msgid "The name or ID of QoS policy to attach to this network." msgstr "" "Der Name oder die ID der QoS-Richtlinie, die diesem Netz zugeordnet werden " "soll." msgid "The name or ID of QoS policy to attach to this port." msgstr "" "Der Name oder die ID der QoS-Richtlinie, die diesem Port zugeordnet werden " "soll." msgid "The name or ID of target cluster." msgstr "Der Name oder die ID des Zielclusters." msgid "The name or ID of the bay model." msgstr "Der Name oder die ID des Bay-Modells." msgid "The name or ID of the subnet on which to allocate the VIP address." msgstr "" "Der Name oder die ID des Subnetzes, fr das die VIP-Adresse zugeordnet " "werden soll." msgid "The name or ID of the subnet pool." msgstr "Der Name oder die ID des Subnetzpools." msgid "The name or id of the Senlin profile." msgstr "Der Name oder die ID des Senlin-Profils." msgid "The next hop for the destination." msgstr "Der nchste Hop fr das Ziel." msgid "The node count for this bay." msgstr "Die Knotenanzahl fr diese Bay." msgid "The number of master nodes for this bay." msgstr "Die Anzahl der Masterknoten fr diese Bay." msgid "The number of seconds to wait for the cluster actions." msgstr "Die Anzahl an Sekunden, die fr die Clusteraktionen gewartet wird." msgid "" "The owner tenant ID of the address scope. Only administrative users can " "specify a tenant ID other than their own." msgstr "" "Die Eigner-Mandanten-ID des Adressbereichs. Nur Benutzer mit " "Verwaltungsaufgaben knnen eine andere als ihre eigene Mandanten-ID angeben." msgid "The owner tenant ID of this QoS policy." msgstr "Die Eigner-Mandanten-ID dieser QoS-Richtlinie." msgid "The owner tenant ID of this rule." msgstr "Die Eigner-Mandanten-ID dieser Regel." msgid "" "The owner tenant ID. Only required if the caller has an administrative role " "and wants to create a RBAC for another tenant." msgstr "" "Die ID des Eignermandanten. Nur erforderlich, wenn der Aufrufer eine " "Verwaltungsrolle hat und eine RBAC fr einen anderen Mandanten erstellen " "mchte." msgid "The status of the secret." msgstr "Der Status des geheimen Schlssels." msgid "" "The string that was stored. This value is also available by referencing the " "resource." msgstr "" "Die Zeichenfolge, die gespeichert wurde. Dieser Wert ist auch durch Verweis " "auf die Ressource verfgbar." msgid "The type of profile." msgstr "Der Typ des Profils." msgid "The type of senlin policy." msgstr "Der Typ der Senlin-Richtlinie." msgid "" "There is no such option during 5.0.0, so need to make this attribute " "unsupported, otherwise error will raised." msgstr "" "Es gibt keine solche Option in 5.0.0. Daher darf es fr dieses Attribut " "keine Untersttzung geben, da andernfalls ein Fehler auftritt. " msgid "" "There is no such option during 5.0.0, so need to make this property " "unsupported while it not used." msgstr "" "Es gibt keine solche Option in 5.0.0. Daher darf es fr diese Eigenschaft " "keine Untersttzung geben, solange sie nicht verwendet wird." msgid "Timeout for creating the bay in minutes. Set to 0 for no timeout." msgstr "" "Zeitlimit in Minuten fr die Erstellung der Bay. Wenn der Wert auf 0 gesetzt " "ist, gibt es kein Zeitlimit." msgid "" "Tokens are not needed for Swift TempURLs. This attribute is being kept for " "compatibility with the OS::Heat::WaitConditionHandle resource." msgstr "" "Tokens sind fr Swift-TempURLs nicht erforderlich. Dieses Attribut wird fr " "die Kompatibilitt mit der OS::Heat::WaitConditionHandle-Ressource " "beibehalten." msgid "Type of the object that RBAC policy affects." msgstr "Der Typ des Objekts, das sich auf die RBAC-Richtlinie auswirkt." "URL for the job binary. Must be in the format swift://<container>/<path> or " "internal-db://<uuid>." msgstr "" "URL fr das Aufgabenbinrprogramm. Muss das Format fr Swift haben: //" "<Container>/<Pfad> oder internal-db://<UUID>." msgid ""msgstr "" "Unbekannter "share_status" beim Erstellen des Freigabeverzeichnisses " ""{0}"." #, python-format msgid "Unknown status creating Bay '%(name)s' - %(reason)s" msgstr "Unbekannter Status beim Erstellen der Bay '%(name)s' - %(reason)s"msgstr "Unbekannter Status beim Lschen des Freigabeverzeichnisses "{0}"." #, python-format msgid "Unknown status updating Bay '%(name)s' - %(reason)s" msgstr "Unbekannter Status beim Aktualisieren der Bay '%(name)s' - %(reason)s""Use get_resource|Ref command instead. For example: { get_resource : " "<resource_name> }" msgstr "" "Verwenden Sie stattdessen den Befehl get_resource|Ref. Beispiel: " "{ get_resource : <Ressourcenname> }" msgid "" "Use of this resource is discouraged. Please use OS::Heat::" "SoftwareDeploymentGroup instead." msgstr "" "Von der Verwendung dieser Ressource wird abgeraten. Verwenden Sie " "stattdessen OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup." msgid "" "Use of this resource is discouraged. Please use OS::Heat::" "StructuredDeploymentGroup instead." msgstr "" "Von der Verwendung dieser Ressource wird abgeraten. Verwenden Sie " "stattdessen OS::Heat::StructuredDeploymentGroup." msgid """Use the `external_gateway_info` property in the router resource to set up " "the gateway." msgstr "" "Verwenden Sie die Eigenschaft `external_gateway_info` in der " "Routerressource, um das Gateway festzulegen." msgid ""msgid "Use this resource at your own risk." msgstr "Die Verwendung dieser Ressource erfolgt auf eigene Gefahr." msgid "Username for accessing the data source URL." msgstr "Benutzername fr den Zugriff auf die Datenquellen-URL." msgid "Username for accessing the job binary URL." msgstr "" "Benutzername fr den Zugriff auf die URL fr das Aufgabenbinrprogramm." msgid "Username of privileged user in the image." msgstr "Benutzername des privilegierten Benutzers im Abbild. " msgid "" "Value which can be set to fail the resource operation to test failure " "scenarios." msgstr "" "Wert, der festgelegt werden kann, sodass die Ressourcenoperation " "fehlschlgt, um Fehlerszenarien zu testen." msgid "" "Value which can be set to trigger update replace for the particular resource." msgstr "" "Wert , der festgelegt werden kann, sodass Ersetzungsaktualisierungen fr " "bestimmte Ressourcen ausgelst werden." msgid "Whether enable this policy on that cluster." msgstr "Gibt an, ob diese Richtlinie auf diesem Cluster aktiviert werden soll." msgid "" "Whether the address scope should be shared to other tenants. Note that the " "default policy setting restricts usage of this attribute to administrative " "users only, and restricts changing of shared address scope to unshared with " "update." msgstr "" "Gibt an, ob der Adressbereich von anderen Mandanten gemeinsam genutzt werden " "soll. Beachten Sie, dass die Standardrichtlinieneinstellungen die Verwendung " "dieses Attributs auf den Benutzer mit Verwaltungsaufgaben beschrnkt und der " "gemeinsam genutzte Adressbereich nur in 'bei Aktualisierung nicht gemeinsam " "genutzt' gendert werden kann." msgid "Whether the flavor is shared across all projects." msgstr "Gibt an, ob die Variante projektbergreifend gemeinsam genutzt wird." msgid "Whether the network contains an external router." msgstr "Gibt an, ob das Netz einen externen Router enthlt." msgid "" "Whether the subnet pool will be shared across all tenants. Note that the " "default policy setting restricts usage of this attribute to administrative " "users only." msgstr "" "Gibt an, ob der Subnetzpool von allen Mandanten gemeinsam genutzt werden " "soll. Beachten Sie, dass die Standardrichtlinieneinstellungen die Verwendung " "dieses Attributs auf Benutzer mit Verwaltungsaufgaben beschrnkt." msgid "Whether this QoS policy should be shared to other tenants." msgstr "" "Gibt an, ob diese QoS-Richtlinie fr andere Mandanten freigegeben werden " "soll. " msgid "" "Whether this is default IPv4/IPv6 subnet pool. There can only be one default " "subnet pool for each IP family. Note that the default policy setting " "restricts administrative users to set this to True." msgstr "" "Gibt an, ob die ein IPv4/IPv6-Subnetzpool ist. Es kann nur einen " "Standardsubnetzpool pro IP-Familie geben. Beachten Sie, dass Benutzer mit " "Verwaltungsaufgaben aufgrund der Standardrichtlinieneinstellung den Wert auf " "'true' setzen mssen." msgid "" "Which lifecycle actions of the deployment resource will result in this " "deployment being triggered." msgstr "" "Gibt an, welche Lebenszyklusaktionen der Implementierungsressource in dieser " "Implementierung ausgelst werden. " msgid "" "Workflow additional parameters. If Workflow is reverse typed, params " "requires 'task_name', which defines initial task." msgstr "" "Zustzliche Arbeitsablaufparameter. Bei Arbeitsablufen vom Typ 'reverse' " "muss der Parameter 'task_name' angegeben werden, um die Anfangsaufgabe zu " "definieren." msgid "" "deployments key not allowed in resource metadata with user_data_format of " "SOFTWARE_CONFIG" msgstr "" "Implementierungsschlssel sind in Ressourcenmetadaten mit 'user_data_format' " "fr SOFTWARE_CONFIG nicht zulssig." #, python-format msgid "" "task %(task)s contains property 'requires' in case of direct workflow. Only " "reverse workflows can contain property 'requires'." msgstr "" "Die Aufgabe %(task)s enthlt die Eigenschaft 'requires' fr einen direkten " "Arbeitsablauf. Die Eigenschaft 'requires' kann jedoch nur fr Arbeitsablufe " "vom Typ 'reverse' verwendet werden."

Add http publisher

This patch adds a http publisher so that notification agent can be
configured to send samples or events directly to a http endpoint.

subject: Set backend content length for fallocate - EC Policy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-20 00:11:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/32d47d390fcb3f99d81726aea7d1cc24d7e247bc', 'message': "WIP: Set backend content length for fallocate - EC Policy

Currently, the ECObjectController removes the 'content-length' header.
This part is ok, except that value is being used to set
'X-Backend-Obj-Content-Length', so it is always 0.  This leads to not
calling fallocate (details on bug) on a PUT since the size is 0.

This change makes use of some numbers returned from the ECDriver
get_segment_info method in order to calculate the expected on-disk
size that should be allocated.  The EC controller will now set the
'X-Backend-Obj-Content-Length' value appropriately.

Why WIP?
See TODO's in the code changes.

Change-Id: Ifd16c1438539e6fd9bb2dbcd053d11bea2e09fee

commit_message:
Set backend content length for fallocate - EC Policy

Currently, the ECObjectController removes the 'content-length' header.
This part is ok, except that value is being used to set
'X-Backend-Obj-Content-Length', so it is always 0.  This leads to not
calling fallocate (details on bug) on a PUT since the size is 0.

This change makes use of some numbers returned from the EC Driver
get_segment_info method in order to calculate the expected on-disk
size that should be allocated.  The EC controller will now set the
'X-Backend-Obj-Content-Length' value appropriately.

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki
Co-Authored-By: John Dickinson
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke
Change-Id: Ifd16c1438539e6fd9bb2dbcd053d11bea2e09fee
Fixes: bug 1532008
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/78/282578/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: chunked=False, expected_frag_archive_size=None): # make sure this isn't there headers.pop('Content-Length') headers['X-Backend-Obj-Content-Length'] = expected_frag_archive_size client_cl = headers.pop('Content-Length', None) expected_frag_size = None if client_cl: policy_index = int(headers.get('X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index')) policy = POLICIES.get_by_index(policy_index) if 2147483648 > int(client_cl) >= policy.ec_segment_size: # TODO - remove condition when get_segment_info handles # larger numbers for data_len. Currently, data_len is int32 # https://bitbucket.org/kmgreen2/pyeclib/pull-requests/34/ # enable-get_segment_info-to-handle-larger/diff # # Determine the expected on-disk size info = policy.pyeclib_driver.get_segment_info( int(client_cl), policy.ec_segment_size) expected_frag_size = info.get('fragment_size') * \ (info.get('num_segments') - 1) + \ info.get('last_fragment_size') if info.get('last_segment_size') > info.get('segment_size'): # TODO - find out why this happens # This happens in test_slo_copy and test_slo_copy_account. # Using these calcuations will result in a 499 on PUT # because the fsize != upload_size. actual is +80 expected_frag_size = None node_timeout=self.app.node_timeout, expected_frag_archive_size=expected_frag_size)
deleted_lines: chunked=False): if 'Content-Length' in headers: headers['X-Backend-Obj-Content-Length'] = \ headers.pop('Content-Length') headers.pop('Content-Length', None) node_timeout=self.app.node_timeout)

commit_message:
Attempt to delete internal resources if create server fail

Attempt to delete queue/user/internal_ports if server hasn't
been created successful yet, to avoid some infos residue.

Change-Id: I9d0dababc996cce559a48d4334d835b4f866df3a
Closes-Bug: #1535227
Related-Bug: #1533074
(cherry picked from commit 2fb51e122c2a647dd44b4befdcaeaa6a9065c3fa)

commit_message:
Fix processing 'pending for deletion' nodes during redeployment

The nodes of deployed environment are marked as
'pending for deletion' aren't processed with
'redeploy-changes' command

Change-Id: I81bb070b0ad93bce226bd3d2c0671c73320d23eb
Closes-bug: #1556898

subject: Devstack failed when install SQLAlchemy-Utils
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 09:21:14.000000000', 'files': ['upper-constraints.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/a57eb31109ccca5665219a222fb74432cd0d4ed9', 'message': "Devstack failed when install SQLAlchemy-Utils

Devstack failed when install SQLAlchemy-Utils, it will show following
error message.

error in SQLAlchemy-Utils setup command: 'extras_require' must be a
dictionary whose values are strings or lists of strings containing valid
project/version requirement specifiers.

Because of version string of password library ( which is required by
SQLAlchemy-Utils) in extras_require dict is not compatible with
setuptools version above 20.1.1. Maybe we could add setuptools to
upper-constrains before SQLAlchemy-Utils had fixed this issue.

Change-Id: I3b20cff2a7f4fb0f08130dc2a0a588b559cd53af
Closes-Bug: 1548591
"}]
commit_message:
Devstack failed when install SQLAlchemy-Utils

Devstack failed when install SQLAlchemy-Utils, it will show following
error message.

error in SQLAlchemy-Utils setup command: 'extras_require' must be a
dictionary whose values are strings or lists of strings containing valid
project/version requirement specifiers.

Because of version string of password library ( which is required by
SQLAlchemy-Utils) in extras_require dict is not compatible with
setuptools version above 20.1.1. Maybe we could add setuptools to
upper-constrains before SQLAlchemy-Utils had fixed this issue.

Change-Id: I3b20cff2a7f4fb0f08130dc2a0a588b559cd53af
Closes-Bug: 1548591
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/06/284606/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: setuptools<20.2.1

commit_message:
Use glance-swift conf for swift backend

For working with Swift backend, Glance needs authentication parameters,
which are supplied to Swift when making calls to its storage system.
Glance will use information from the file specified under parameter
swift_store_config_file. When this parameter is set to the same file
(glance-api.conf), we have lot of non-critical errors in glance-api
log, because of 'Invalid format of swift store config'.
The same problem, when we have RadosGW.

Change-Id: I18ee8f68f7ce793d2580685e79ed636556c57ddd
Related-bug: #1540890
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/89/278489/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Puppet::Type.type(:glance_swift_config).provide( :ini_setting, :parent => Puppet::Type.type(:openstack_config).provider(:ini_setting) ) do def self.file_path '/etc/glance/glance-swift.conf' end end

commit_message:
nodepool: Use db setup for python jobs

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
This repo needs databases setup for unit tests.

Change-Id: Id42e5bc868b424e0a07ce09a7755c2acf1f2f949

commit_message:
module docs are not being generated

The pbr section in setup.cfg is not defined, so the module docs are not being
generated. This causes the 404 when clicking on the Module Index link under
the 'Indices and Tables section in [0].

[0] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/mistral/

Change-Id: I337e9f6e78257a3e8e9222779dfcd600ba6cebd8
Closes-bug: #1558574
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/86/294186/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [pbr] autodoc_tree_index_modules = True

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from fuelmenu.common.modulehelper import ModuleHelper from fuelmenu.common import utils import urwid blank = urwid.Divider() class security(object): def __init__(self, parent): self.name = "Security Setup" self.priority = 6 self.visible = True self.parent = parent self.screen = None # UI text self.header_content = ["Security settings", ""] self.fields = ["SSH_NETWORK"] # default settings try: ssh_network = self.parent.settings["FUEL_ACCESS"]["ssh_network"] except KeyError: ssh_network = self.parent.settings["ADMIN_NETWORK"]["cidr"] self.defaults = \ { "SSH_NETWORK": {"label": "Restrict SSH access on network ", "tooltip": "Enter network address in CIDR format", "value": ssh_network}, } self.screen = None def check(self, args): self.parent.footer.set_text("Checking data...") self.parent.refreshScreen() responses = dict() for index, fieldname in enumerate(self.fields): if fieldname != "blank": responses[fieldname] = self.edits[index].get_edit_text() ssh_network = responses["SSH_NETWORK"] if len(ssh_network) == 0: self.parent.footer.set_text("Address is empty, " "no changes will be made.") log.warning("Empty address, skipping.") else: self.parent.footer.set_text("No errors found.") return ssh_network def apply(self, args): ssh_network = self.check(args) if ssh_network is False: log.error("Check failed. Not applying") return False newsettings = {'FUEL_ACCESS': { 'ssh_network': ssh_network, }} self.parent.settings.merge(newsettings) return True def refresh(self): pass def screenUI(self): return ModuleHelper.screenUI(self, self.header_content, self.fields, self.defaults)

commit_message:
Do not publish translated Debian Guide

The RST Debian Install Guide is not maintained, there's no need to build
and publish it. We continue pushing strings to translate.openstack.org
but will not build it.

Change-Id: I2dddb437a693d91d8116cb3b5ee76e008429b0c0

subject: New Project - jacket
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-05 00:51:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b850b521b3258e88bc94e4cf6eaeeed216e873c2', 'message': 'New Project - jacket

jacket is a project that can manage the heterogeneous clouds via
OpenStack, for example, vmWare private cloud which is built by
vmWare vCloud Director, vmWare vCloud Air, AWS public cloud,
Windows Azure and so on.

This project will offer the nova-compute drivers and cinder-volume
drivers for the heterogeneous clouds. Users can use the standard
OpenStack API to manage the VMs and volumes in different clouds,
for example create/delete/list/show the VMs and volumes, and the
3rd part tools based on OpenStack can be used, too. The different
clouds can be managed at the same time as the different
availability zones in OpenStack.

The project can reduce the learning cost for users who need manage
 the multi-vendor heterogeneous clouds, and users only need learn
how to use OpenStack API.

vCloud Air, the private clouds based on VMware vCloud Director and
so on. And users can manage these clouds just like one cloud.

commit_message:
New Project - jacket

Now there are many people and enterprises using private clouds
and public clouds, such as OpenStack, VMware vCloud Director, AWS,
Azure and so on. Because clouds' API models are different from
each other, users will meet the following problems:
* High cost of learning
* Large workload to deploy the business in a new cloud
* Difficult to scale out the workload across the different clouds

The target of jacket project is to offer the standard OpenStack
API model for these heterogeneous clouds.

Jacket project's wiki is https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Jacket.

Change-Id: Iaa88e46ec2de1c013611572ed4779e7c289a6e64

commit_message:
Data containers restart and lose data on update/upgrade

During release update/upgrade data container will restart and
will lose data. With pull policy set to missing we never
restart them.

Change-Id: I1b86f0af4481b99f085aa8a59b18003246607444
Closes-Bug: #1521231

commit_message:
nbd module is not found during vm boot

nova-compute requires nbd module when booting a vm. If the module
is not present it gives many error messages about missing it.

Change-Id: I5216a5de19d50c6b6da1efb715cecb6e9edf11c4
Closes-Bug: #1510855

commit_message:
cinder,glance,heat: Use db setup for python jobs

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
These repos need databases setup for unit tests.

Change-Id: I13aaab4ca680377230755799e332cf38cac77cec

subject: Note requirement for parted on gentoo hosts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-20 03:06:42.000000000', 'files': ['elements/gentoo/README.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/8fc5a17f3a20dba5dffa764f52cd05b04666d83e', 'message': 'Note requirement for parted on gentoo hosts

The vm element makes use of parted.  In order to create partitions

Change-Id: Ib46cb818e0116f050de01f9a19e6041328d6d478
'}]
commit_message:
Note requirement for parted on gentoo hosts

The vm element makes use of parted.  In order to create partitions
parted needs to be installed, growroot does not work without partitions.

Change-Id: Ib46cb818e0116f050de01f9a19e6041328d6d478
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/72/294972/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: point to the latest image, but will frequently change its content. The versioned one will never change content, but will frequently be deleted and replaced by a newer build with a higher version-release number.* In order to run the vm element you will need to make sure `sys-block/parted` is installed on the host.
deleted_lines: point to the latest image, but will frequently change its content. The versioned one will never change content, but will frequently be deleted and replaced by a newer build with a higher version-release number.

commit_message:
oslo.db: Use db setup for python jobs

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
This repo needs databases setup for unit tests.

Change-Id: I8dac66bda4f28606f7009a273425b6d7f1869910

commit_message:
Revert "Install master's version of an RDO keystone"

This commit installed a custom built version of master RDO keystone.
In order for the gate to pass, this custom built version needs to be
reverted.

This reverts commit c5f27aa8a69cffd4393ad56dbee1acd7ed5ba4bf.

Change-Id: I440c38e485c1ee345c64b1172551bd5a11793716
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/52/295552/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # TODO(sdake)Revert this change before release of Mitaka RUN yum -y install https://copr-be.cloud.fedoraproject.org/results/sdake/Keystone/epel-7-x86_64/00167586-openstack-keystone/openstack-keystone-9.0.0-0.sdake.el7.centos.noarch.rpm \ https://copr-be.cloud.fedoraproject.org/results/sdake/Keystone/epel-7-x86_64/00167586-openstack-keystone/python-keystone-9.0.0-0.sdake.el7.centos.noarch.rpm \

subject: Add support of microversion in all compute service clients
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-24 21:22:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/f8196b44c332c38bcf238e5e44292960ba65ac68', 'message': 'Add support of microversion in all compute service clients

Tempest implemented microversion support testing framework
which can set the microversion on service client and further
will be used to pass to API request.

To support setting of microversion on each compute service client
and passing the same in API request, we need to inherit all
compute service clients from BaseComputeClient.

BaseComputeClient class pass the microversion in API request header
and checks the correct microversion is being returned in response.

NOTE- This change to all compute service clients does not change
any interface which means no backward incompatibility is introduced.

Afer this change, all compute service clients will support to pass
microversion on API request.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions-testing-support

Change-Id: I44de9db6790148148df779810c67b272a7938d56

commit_message:
Add support of microversion in all compute service clients

Tempest implemented microversion support testing framework
which can set the microversion on service client and further
will be used to pass to API request.

To support setting of microversion on each compute service client
and passing the same in API request, we need to inherit all
compute service clients from BaseComputeClient.

BaseComputeClient class pass the microversion in API request header
and checks the correct microversion is being returned in response.

NOTE- This change to all compute service clients does not change
any interface which means no backward incompatibility is introduced.

After this change, all compute service clients will support to pass
microversion on API request.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions-testing-support

Change-Id: I44de9db6790148148df779810c67b272a7938d56

commit_message:
ironic,ironic-inspector: Use db setup for python jobs

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
This repo needs databases setup for unit tests.

Change-Id: I6056603fed09a486789808e3097d4c2a44a1acbe

commit_message:
Allow cssfiles added by sphinx extensions

Sphinx extensions support the concept of adding css files, which is
often quite important in getting particular theming into
components. The openstackdocstheme currently completely ignores this,
which prevents it being used where sphinx extensions are needed.

Change-Id: Ieb71a071796a37fcfaec2dde9aaa8b153adea27a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/89/295489/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix publishing of api-guide

The api-guide needs to generate html in api-guide/build/html so that the
infra scripts can publish it. Fix tox.ini for this.

Change-Id: Ie47fb9788fe918a5a8aad7e5e8743fe890cbf0d7

commit_message:
Add 'prev_marker' parameter to pagination in tables

Change-Id: Ib18f06d8568084502d271ff7853a836bfd31d819
Closes-bug: #1447218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/39/295439/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: opts = { 'include_disabled': True } prev_marker = self.request.GET.get( tables.PackageDefinitionsTable._meta.prev_pagination_param, None) if prev_marker is not None: marker = prev_marker else: marker = self.request.GET.get( tables.PackageDefinitionsTable._meta.pagination_param, None) reversed_order = prev_marker is not None self._prev = self._more = False with api.handled_exceptions(self.request): packages, self._more, self._prev = pkg_api.package_list( self.request, marker=marker, filters=opts, paginate=True, sort_dir='asc', sort_key='name', reversed_order=reversed_order,
deleted_lines: sort_dir = self.request.GET.get('sort_dir', 'asc') opts = { 'include_disabled': True, 'sort_dir': sort_dir, } marker = self.request.GET.get( tables.PackageDefinitionsTable._meta.pagination_param, None) opts = self.get_filters(opts) with api.handled_exceptions(self.request): packages, extra = pkg_api.package_list( self.request, marker=marker, filters=opts, paginate=True, if sort_dir == 'asc': self._more = extra else: packages = list(reversed(packages)) self._prev = extra if packages: if sort_dir == 'asc': backward_marker = packages[0].id opts['sort_dir'] = 'desc' else: backward_marker = packages[-1].id opts['sort_dir'] = 'asc' __, extra = pkg_api.package_list( self.request, filters=opts, paginate=True, marker=backward_marker, page_size=0) if sort_dir == 'asc': self._prev = extra else: self._more = extra

commit_message:
Decode injected content when checking length limit

According to the API reference:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#createServer
the limit of content length should be the limit of decoded
data, not the base64 encoded data.

This patch fix this problem.

Change-Id: I107ff696cd74df494427e4e99b20f9fadb04e364
Closes-bug: #1550671
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/49/285649/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: decoded_content = base64.b64decode(content).encode('utf-8') max_content = max(max_content, len(decoded_content))
deleted_lines: max_content = max(max_content, len(content))

commit_message:
Allow show public baymodel

We can not get public baymodel now.

Fix it by:

1. Union public baymodel when fetch baymodel from DB.
2. Don't apply policy checking if the baymodel is public

Closes-Bug: #1557977
Change-Id: Ie5b1432d06611cd697a55f67fd66207e1e757382

commit_message:
Prevent update of attrs when new_device_dict is None

Whenver user wants to update VNF and exception is raised in
heat.py, VNF status continues to be PENDING_UPDATE instead of ERROR.
This patch will change VNF status to ERROR whenever update()
in heat.py raises an Exception. This is accomplished by checking
the new_device_dict value before updating attrs in
_update_device_post().

Change-Id: I46b674ba90ced4495dbbb6460bf9981ad8c78bc7
Closes-Bug: #1525808

subject: Drop `delegate_to` and `run_once` in bootstrap task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-22 06:03:16.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/deploy.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/e0c7a6730a68cf2b0ed1b304ec8a668a0f3e8b3c', 'message': 'Drop `delegate_to` and `run_once` in bootstrap task

As run_once will always target the first host in the
list, if that host is supposed to skip a set of tasks
(for instance, when), it will also skip any run_once
tasks even though they delegate_to other hosts which
are willing to run that task.

This changes drop delegate_to and run_once, use
`when` replace, Refer to:
http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html#run-once
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/9784

Change-Id: I82b38ac15e055f193b72b5e5b00c7bb6c7d176e0
Closes-Bug: #1520728

commit_message:
Drop `delegate_to` and `run_once` in bootstrap task

As run_once will always target the first host in the
list, if that host is supposed to skip a set of tasks
(for instance, when), it will also skip any run_once
tasks even though they delegate_to other hosts which
are willing to run that task.

This changes drop delegate_to and run_once, use
`when` replace, Refer to:
http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html#run-once
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/9784

Change-Id: I82b38ac15e055f193b72b5e5b00c7bb6c7d176e0
Closes-Bug: #1520728

commit_message:
Avoid cooldown when group size does not change

Cooldown behavior changed in commit:
50cc71e33c40a9e3be604b16f77d3c3cf030a63b

Restore the cooldown behavior so that when a group does not encounter
scaling activity, a cooldown period is not activated.

Closes-Bug: #1555748
Change-Id: Icf5df6a48afb9f56aa1c3f1622d33b9998aca39c

commit_message:
Allow to parameterize image name in tests

Add the ability to pass an image name using an env
var, to provide more flexibility on image testing.

subject: Skip already checked partitions when auditing objects after a restart
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-12 09:44:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/e7479e581f24463a6c041efe362154220b80a965', 'message': 'Start object-auditing with last partition after restart

The object auditor will save a short status file on each device, containing a
list of remaining partitions for auditing. If the auditor is restarted, it might
start with a different device; however, it will only parse partitions not yet
done. Finally, when there are no more remaining partitions, it will re-read the
list of partitions from disk and start over.

Closes-Bug: #1183656

Change-Id: Icf1d920d0942ce48f1d3d374ea4d63dbc29ea464
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-12 11:22:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/08f3129cb5c9c0ced75d936e164bbdc04ae61425', 'message': 'Start object-auditing with last partition after restart

The object auditor will save a short status file on each device, containing a
list of remaining partitions for auditing. If the auditor is restarted, it might
start with a different device; however, it will only parse partitions not yet
done. Finally, when there are no more remaining partitions, it will re-read the
list of partitions from disk and start over.

Closes-Bug: #1183656

Change-Id: Icf1d920d0942ce48f1d3d374ea4d63dbc29ea464
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-12 12:32:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/8e996a8702f3aee282c6c724dca3d8ead55a21b8', 'message': 'Start object-auditing with last partition after restart

The object auditor will save a short status file on each device, containing a
list of remaining partitions for auditing. If the auditor is restarted, it might
start with a different device; however, it will only parse partitions not yet
done. Finally, when there are no more remaining partitions, it will re-read the
list of partitions from disk and start over.

Closes-Bug: #1183656

Change-Id: Icf1d920d0942ce48f1d3d374ea4d63dbc29ea464
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-13 08:17:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/fd5db296f70c5afe0289651e6ba043eceb83f7e9', 'message': 'Start object-auditing with last partition after restart

The object auditor will save a short status file on each device, containing a
list of remaining partitions for auditing. If the auditor is restarted, it might
start with a different device; however, it will only parse partitions not yet
done. Finally, when there are no more remaining partitions, it will re-read the
list of partitions from disk and start over.

An empty list is kept on each disk to avoid re-auditing this disk before all
disks have been audited. Once all partitions on all disks are successfully
audited, all status files are removed.

Closes-Bug: #1183656

Change-Id: Icf1d920d0942ce48f1d3d374ea4d63dbc29ea464
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-13 08:20:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/755855e380deb6a0eb8d79b98468bd936695f991', 'message': 'Start object-auditing with last partition after restart

The object auditor will save a short status file on each device, containing a
list of remaining partitions for auditing. If the auditor is restarted, it might
start with a different device; however, it will only parse partitions not yet
done. Finally, when there are no more remaining partitions, it will re-read the
list of partitions from disk and start over.

An empty list is kept on each disk to avoid re-auditing this disk before all
disks have been audited. Once all partitions on all disks are successfully
audited, all status files are removed.

Closes-Bug: #1183656

Change-Id: Icf1d920d0942ce48f1d3d374ea4d63dbc29ea464
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-13 20:52:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/8d2ca0e7093fd824f6b0902a05386fcb591354ae', 'message': 'Skip already checked partitions when auditing objects after a restart

The object auditor will save a short status file on each device, containing a
list of remaining partitions for auditing. If the auditor is restarted, it will
only audit partitions not yet checked. If all partitions on the current device

commit_message:
Skip already checked partitions when auditing objects after a restart

The object auditor will save a short status file on each device, containing a
list of remaining partitions for auditing. If the auditor is restarted, it will
only audit partitions not yet checked. If all partitions on the current device
have been checked, it will simply skip this device. Once all partitions on all
disks are successfully audited, all status files are removed.

Closes-Bug: #1183656

Change-Id: Icf1d920d0942ce48f1d3d374ea4d63dbc29ea464

added_lines: import json partitions = get_remaining_partitions(datadir_path) if len(partitions) == 0: partitions = listdir(datadir_path) for partition in partitions: pos = partitions.index(partition) update_remaining_partitions(datadir_path, partitions[pos:]) update_remaining_partitions(datadir_path, []) def get_remaining_partitions(datadir_path): auditor_status = os.path.join(datadir_path, "auditor_status.json") status = None try: with open(auditor_status) as statusfile: status = statusfile.read() except (OSError, IOError) as err: return [] try: status = json.loads(status) except Exception as exc: return [] return status.get('partitions', []) def update_remaining_partitions(datadir_path, partitions): status = json.dumps({'partitions': partitions}) auditor_status = os.path.join(datadir_path, "auditor_status.json") try: with open(auditor_status, "wb") as statusfile: statusfile.write(status) except (OSError, IOError) as err: pass

commit_message:
Tintri image direct clone

Fix for the bug 1400966 prevents user from specifying image nfs
share location as location value for an image.
This broke Tintri's image direct clone feature.

This addresses the issue by using provider_location of image
metadata to specify image nfs share location.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1528969
Co-Authored-By: opencompute xuchenx@gmail.com

Change-Id: Icdf2f229d79d5631604e87dd9dd30a1608e6b010

subject: Handling Invalid argument iflag=direct in dd
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 19:10:33.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/b2a1d2808ddeefe43e65785a8e74ea09ffdf03bd', 'message': 'Handling Invalid argument iflag=direct in dd

During volume/snapshot create/delete operations,
dd command is used to clear contents of disk.

Before invoking dd, it is checked if iflag=direct
supports dd or not by executing dd command with
iflag=direct and if=/dev/zero combination.
But this always results in invalid argument
error.

Handling for this argument is done to eliminate
unnecessary call to dd command when it is used
with iflag=direct and if=/dev/zero combination
to check if this argument supports dd or not.

Closes-Bug: #1270362

Change-Id: Ic6dd029ca1a339076e491c38ef3c69315497f189
(cherry picked from commit 5e363eb194e3d33e9a71b7f2f900e5c6dc13a0b1)
'}]
commit_message:
Handling Invalid argument iflag=direct in dd

During volume/snapshot create/delete operations,
dd command is used to clear contents of disk.

Before invoking dd, it is checked if iflag=direct
supports dd or not by executing dd command with
iflag=direct and if=/dev/zero combination.
But this always results in invalid argument
error.

Handling for this argument is done to eliminate
unnecessary call to dd command when it is used
with iflag=direct and if=/dev/zero combination
to check if this argument supports dd or not.

Closes-Bug: #1270362

Change-Id: Ic6dd029ca1a339076e491c38ef3c69315497f189
(cherry picked from commit 5e363eb194e3d33e9a71b7f2f900e5c6dc13a0b1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/68/294768/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mock_exec.reset_mock() output = volume_utils.check_for_odirect_support('/dev/zero', '/dev/def', 'iflag=direct') self.assertFalse(output) mock_exec.reset_mock() output = volume_utils.check_for_odirect_support('/dev/zero', '/dev/def') self.assertTrue(output) mock_exec.assert_called_once_with('dd', 'count=0', 'if=/dev/zero', 'of=/dev/def', 'oflag=direct', run_as_root=True) mock_exec.reset_mock() output = volume_utils.check_for_odirect_support('/dev/zero', '/dev/def') self.assertFalse(output) mock_exec.assert_called_once_with('dd', 'count=0', 'if=/dev/zero', 'of=/dev/def', 'oflag=direct', run_as_root=True)

commit_message:
Fix murano app repo link for liberty

The app catalog has changed for filtering, and this fixes a broken link
in the murano dashboard to import catalogs.

Change-Id: I2fc9e1ddb814423d22df9e6b68be8235a6edd580
Closes-Bug: #1542776

commit_message:
Install OVS via the OS and make it an OS service

Install openvswitch and run it as an OS service, rather than installing
it manually from source.

Change-Id: I16ee3a52f82b80abfd2fbc375d06b8c0eabc0db8
Closes-Bug: 1530878
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/48/284748/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove gabbi tests that check content-location

The content-location header is an artifact of using httplib2
and not something that ceilometer itself returns. Gabbi is going
to stop using httplib2 (and so is much of OpenStack) so to prepare
for that these tests need to stop testing something that doesn't
really mean anything.

Change-Id: If5aacaf108402146d66fee474793dde1c0a59a7c

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-21 22:39:43.000000000', 'files': ['gulp/tasks/browserify.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health/commit/625999f337b30505051c9f2461594a289a2b841a', 'message': "Fix sourcemap generation for dev builds

This commit makes gulp unconditionally create external-file sourcemaps
for dev builds. Currently dev builds create both external and inline
sourcemaps, which seems to confuse browsers and often prevents maps
from loading. Additionally, this enables 'loadMaps' for the gulp
sourcemap plugin to make sure that all sourcemaps from browserify are

Change-Id: I9fcb945d639a60c19c94d688ff26126c8f49e256
"}]
commit_message:
Fix sourcemap generation for dev builds

This commit makes gulp unconditionally create external-file sourcemaps
for dev builds. Currently dev builds create both external and inline
sourcemaps, which seems to confuse browsers and often prevents maps
from loading. Additionally, this enables 'loadMaps' for the gulp
sourcemap plugin to make sure that all sourcemaps from browserify are
moved into the external file, fixing maps for dependencies.

Change-Id: I9fcb945d639a60c19c94d688ff26126c8f49e256
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/55/295555/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: var createSourcemap = config.browserify.sourcemap; .pipe(gulpif(createSourcemap, sourcemaps.init({ loadMaps: true })))
deleted_lines: var createSourcemap = global.isProd && config.browserify.sourcemap; .pipe(gulpif(createSourcemap, sourcemaps.init()))

commit_message:
Add subnet_allocation extension to DF plugin

This extension is needed for subnet pools but also
needed for auto-allocated-topology extension which is
automatically enabled and caused errors in DF plugin.

Change-Id: I2d8ab09712a30ab972d0ef29c04decc9d2198039

commit_message:
Router interface delete when you add interface with port.

If you add a router interface with a port,you will delete it
when you remove router interface.

Change-Id: I8453a45a1369cee448d4b8edd0e734992cf8f55f
Closes-Bug: #1552056

subject: Allow option to disable Swift ring management

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-21 17:45:46.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/84d7592925f16b8008fe3059a63cca433f91853d', 'message': 'Allow option to disable Swift ring management

There are quite a few cases where it is useful to disable ring building on the
nodes. For example:

- using different weights, regions, and zones
- replacing a node in an existing Swift cluster
- adding a new node to an existing cluster
- using storage policies and therefore multiple rings
- using different nodes and disks for account, container and object servers

This patch allows it to disable ring building. Rings need to be maintained

it uses the current templates.

Change-Id: I56978b15823dd6eaf4b6fd3440df2f895e89611a
(cherry picked from commit 83b8bb7bfa420a3f2d03821bf0280f9fb55f1c18)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow option to disable Swift ring management

There are quite a few cases where it is useful to disable ring building on the
nodes. For example:

- using different weights, regions, and zones
- replacing a node in an existing Swift cluster
- adding a new node to an existing cluster
- using storage policies and therefore multiple rings
- using different nodes and disks for account, container and object servers

This patch allows it to disable ring building. Rings need to be maintained
manually then, and copied to all storage and proxy nodes within a cluster.

This patch is similar to I01311ec3ca265b151f8740bf7dc57cdf0cf0df6f, except that
it uses the current templates.

Change-Id: I56978b15823dd6eaf4b6fd3440df2f895e89611a
(cherry picked from commit 83b8bb7bfa420a3f2d03821bf0280f9fb55f1c18)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/26/295426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RingBuild: default: true description: Whether to manage Swift rings or not type: boolean tripleo::ringbuilder::build_ring: { get_input: swift_ring_build } swift_ring_build: {get_param: RingBuild}
deleted_lines: # Swift # NOTE(dprince): build_ring support is currently not wired in. # See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/109225/ tripleo::ringbuilder::build_ring: True

commit_message:
Add non-voting diskimage-builder jobs

This commit allows the definition of non-voting gate jobs by defining
a new job-suffix. 'extras' was added as a new job pre-suffix because
just 'nv' implies we would be testing the same things as the
non-postfixed variant.  This was done to facilitate adding a Gentoo
non-voting gate job, also in this commit.

Change-Id: I08f35397a4cce05b90d88077922dc38ece5c2b55
Depends-On: I0d2768a912b350e1b2cf40d2fd227fdc767b1bcb
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

added_lines: try: self.client.update_port_postcommit(id, p) if p['status'] != n_const.PORT_STATUS_ACTIVE: data = {'port': {'status': n_const.PORT_STATUS_ACTIVE}} super(MidonetPluginV2, self).update_port(context, id, data) except Exception as ex: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to update a port %(port_id)s in " "MidoNet: %(err)s"), {"port_id": id, "err": ex}) try: data = {'port': {'status': n_const.PORT_STATUS_ERROR}} super(MidonetPluginV2, self).update_port(context, id, data) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE("Failed to update port status %s"), id)

added_lines: # backup current data so that the data will be restored with # previous data to stave off inconsistent # between backend and neutron when backend failure. bk_params = ['name', 'admin_state_up', 'external_gateway_info', 'routes'] bk_body = {'router': self.get_router(context, id, bk_params)} try: self.client.update_router_postcommit(id, r) except Exception as ex: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to update a router %(r_id)s in Midonet:" "%(err)s"), {"r_id": id, "err": ex}) try: super(MidonetL3ServicePlugin, self).update_router(context, id, bk_body) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE("Failed to update a router " "for rollback %s"), id)
deleted_lines: self.client.update_router_postcommit(id, r)

commit_message:
Remove true/false return from action.execute()

In watcher/applier/workflow_engine/default.py, we are checking the
return value of action.execute(). As the "TODO" above indicates it
(line 118), we should get rid of this and only flag an action as
failed if an exception was raised during its execute(). We will
need to update the related unit tests.

Change-Id: Ia8ff7abd9994c3504e733ccd1d629cafe9d4b839
Closes-Bug: #1548383
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/41/284541/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: result = self.engine.execute(actions) self.assertEqual(result, True) result = self.engine.execute(actions) self.assertEqual(result, True) result = self.engine.execute(actions) self.assertEqual(result, True) result = self.engine.execute(actions) self.assertEqual(result, True) result = self.engine.execute(actions) self.assertEqual(result, True) result = self.engine.execute(actions) self.assertEqual(result, False) result = self.engine.execute(actions) self.assertEqual(result, False)

subject: OpenStack wide Error Codes for Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-10 20:05:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-specs/commit/f4d29a31524b68d6af3f8000eb7ced97b60266a6', 'message': 'OpenStack wide Error Codes for Log Messages

Error codes in Log messages provide operators a way to quickly garner information from logs. They provide consistency across projects and services, consistency in translations, and consistency across the multiple log files that are spread across both physical and virtual boundaries in Cloud based installations.

This document provides consistency across projects while maintaining flexibility per project.

Change-Id: I3aef34d276fe77de79a78ad6e2a8426b88f00795

consistency across the multiple log files that are spread across
