commit_message:
OpenStack wide Error Codes for Log Messages

Error codes in Log messages provide operators a way to quickly
garner information from logs. They provide consistency across
projects and services, consistency in translations, and
consistency across the multiple log files that are spread across
both physical and virtual boundaries in Cloud based installations.

This document provides consistency across projects while
maintaining flexibility per project.

Change-Id: I3aef34d276fe77de79a78ad6e2a8426b88f00795
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-specs refs/changes/52/172552/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== OpenStack Projects Error Codes ========================================== The URL of project specific launchpad blueprints: * Glance: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/error-codes OpenStack includes a very large number of log files generated by its running projects. Access, collation and quick comprehension of the errors that are generated by the running systems is critical to maintaining and managing a robust Cloud system. Error Codes as part of the Error Message, have long been used by computer, IT, and Telecom systems to provide a quick, clean and consistent way to get a pointer to the subsystem, type and area of the problem associated with the error code. They speed online searches for root causes and solutions. Error codes also enable better translations as a side effect of containing the codes and summaries in databases which maintain the idempotency of each error code. Problem description =================== Log messages across OpenStack "integrated" projects do not currently have any requirements to implement any community standards or formats. A common log library was just recently introduced, and although just out of incubation, there is now at least a basic log library under the Oslo umbrella that helps promote consistency across projects. Lack of formatting consistency has created problems for operators, other end users and even developers when deploying, testing, and maintaining OpenStack clouds. Use of the Oslo library will increase consistency of messages, and along with community standards, improve the logging functionality. While there are many improvements possible to OpenStack log messages through the log library and community standards, this spec intends to address only the concept and definition of error codes. For each generated message, error codes are intended to increase clarity of the message, searchability for more indepth descriptions, and to improve the level of translation at the summary level of the message. Rationale ========= Error codes help clarify logging messages and aid in performing root cause analysis. They can also be used within the code itself for directing error handling. When an error is generated, the same codes can be used for both coding exception handling and human accessible error reporting. This also allows for a unique message to be associated with each error code that is more descriptive and that can be pre translated. Again, for logging purposes, the error code would not be part of the message payload, but part of the headers. Referrer IDs and other info would still be expected in the payload of the message and could include instance ids/names, NICs or VIFs, etc. The message headers are part of the Oslo.log library, making use and enforcement straightforward. Proposed change =============== The error codes concept and definition are introduced here, with guidance for project specific implementations and as best practice across OpenStack projects. The project level implementations must take into consideration who the for each error message will be and tailor the information as appropriate to ensure the message will not compromise system security. Such actions as not including sensitive information in the error code or its summary and scrubbing the messages of exploitable information is of critical importance, but is enforced through the code review process. Taking into account who will have access to the logs each message is directed to is also critical as Cloud operators will be expected to be highly trusted and safeguard the log information, while tenant operators may or may not be considered trustworthy and should therefore receive log information that is limited to what they need to operate and manage their onw VMs, storage and networks. Error Codes for logs would have four segments separated by dashes. * the first segment will be a three letter code identifying the project software the error is generated from. Projects would choose their letters such that operators and other end user will recognize the project quickly, or would remember the correlation after looking it up once or twice. As the OpenStack ecosystem grows, there is the possibility of a project might choose an already used code, so a way to register the code to a central repository could ensure programmatically that the code is used by only one project. * The second segment is two characters, either two letters or a number and a letter. This segment is Either a two letter vendor code or a number and letter for 0+letter for internal component of project (like API=0A, Controller=0C, etc), four digit error number which could be subsetted for even finer granularity, and a criticality number. * The third segment is a four digit integer uniquely identifying the error within the parameters of the project and component. Historically, these numbers have often been subdivided further to indicate specific areas within the code or specific types of errors; the further delegation of numbers is left to the discretion of the project. * The last, single integer is a Criticality Value. Again, historically, this has been used to highlight the severity of the error, but even the inclusion of this integer is open for discussion and this section will either be expanded or deleted before a merge based on discussions on the reviews. Project Vendor/Component Error Catalog number Criticality Def [A-Z][A-Z][A-Z]- [{0-9}|{A-Z}][A-Z]- [0000-9999]- [0-9] Ex. CIN- NA- 0001- 2 Cinder NetApp driver error no Criticality Ex. GLA- 0A- 0051- 3 Glance Api error no Criticality The same error code would be included in the log message and corresponding message provided to the user. This way any event that happens is easily identified on both ends. The lowest level code would be carried to the user. This meaning that we do not assign new code nor overwrite it when the exception is catched and reraised, this would improve traceability. Log event might have the current location prefixed with second code, but we should never use more than that within the project to avoid confusion. Logging/assigning the second code should be used only on DEBUG level and marked to documentation as "DEBUG:". Code would be also assigned to the log events which does not get reported to end user to help the operators on their troubleshooting. INFO level messages should never have error code assigned to them. Documentation of the error codes and their possible causes would be generated. The documentation would activate end users more to self service when trying to troubleshoot their issues on specific action. In the case other projects will adopt this the existing code should always be respected. The first moment any given project gets the event, project specific code should be added for traceability. For example: Swift raises exc with swift error code; Glance catches and adds it own error as this is first time Glance touches the issue; Glance raises exception to Nova which adds Nova error code. This does bring us string of errors, but will give exceptional well documented traceback where the issue got initiated and what path it took. Alternatives ------------ Refactor for Consistency: Refactoring the logging and exception messages to reflect each other better in a systematic way per project. Pros: * Would lighten the needed documentation work. * Would provide a way to retranslate all error messages for the project during the refactor cycle * Many error messages need to be refactored anyway to provide better information. Cons: * It does not uniquely link the error and log message. * No way to remove duplicates throughout the code base. Each error has to be unique to the calling method * Removes possibility to provide different information to end user and operator. Translation solution: Lazy translation for log messages or tracking down all error level calls to logs in the code base and translating the content pre-release Pros: Lazy translation only has to be as good as there is time for Cons: All error level calls still need to be reviewed and perhaps refactored but consistency is harder to maintain across projects * Consistency alternative: More strictly enforcing Logging Guidelines during code reviews * Refactoring the logging and exception messages to reflect each other better. Consistency Solution: More strictly enforcing Logging Guidelines during code reviews * Refactoring the logging and exception messages to reflect each other better when code is changed for other reasons Pros: * Would lighten the needed documentation work. Cons: * It does not uniquely link the error and log message. * Detecting duplicates throught the code base is heavy process. * Removes possibility to provide different information to end user and operator Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Technically none, the message field of the responses would change. Security impact --------------- Potential attacker would get also better knowledge to which layer/function/ step ones attack reached. This change does not have technical security impact. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Improves end user self serviceability and user experience as more detailed feedback is available on issue situations. End user support experience improvements via faster resolution times. Performance Impact ------------------ None. We will need to process more strings when raising exceptions, but this is no way noticeable. Other deployer impact --------------------- * The change in log messages would take effect after deployment. No config options would be provided. Change in current log messages might need attention for those who monitor for specific events. * Filtering specific events from the logs becomes lots easier. * Better documented error/failure conditions. Developer impact ---------------- * Debugging becomes easier via consistent, documented and traceable log events. * New logging needs code assigned from the pool and that code needs to be documented. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Glance: jokke Other contributors: rockyg dhellmann Work Items ---------- 1) Identify original exception raises (not except ... raise, etc.) per module and assign next free code to those from the start of the assigned pool. 2) Change the exception messages to include the error code and add that to logged message as well if different. At this stage the code needs to be documented to reflect the block in the code. 3) Identify logging events that would need code assigned but does not have related exception (and keep the documentation updated): 3.a) DEBUG level logging from the end of the assigned pool (this includes the messages where exception is expected and relogged elswhere) 3.b) Other logged events should get next free code assigned from beginning Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== The documentation should be built during the implementation process. References ========== Syslog RFC: http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc5424.html https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kilo-glance-summit-topics

commit_message:
Add test to check error message for bundle-import with invalid file format

Test case checks that error message after calling bundle-import with
invalid bundle file format contains user friendly substring

Targets: blueprint murano-cli-integration-test-coverage

Change-Id: I7b39cdfcd7c05995c6c9ed510672b486717c59f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/29/285129/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_bundle_import_with_invalid_file_format(self): """Test scenario: 1) Execute murano bundle-import command with invalid bundle file format 2) check that error message contains user friendly substring """ try: self.murano( 'bundle-import', params=self.prepare_bundle_with_invalid_format(), fail_ok=False) except utils.exceptions.CommandFailed as exception: self.assertIn("Can't parse bundle contents", exception.stdout)

commit_message:
Use bay to init K8sAPI instead of bay_uuid

This patch aimed to reduce db call count when we invode k8sAPI.

For those user using bay name to do pod/rc/service operations, we
can saving a db call.

Change-Id: I1488d0526e1d444cb681b408f8a13ce25b4aee6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/11/294511/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def retrieve_bay(context, bay_ident): if not utils.is_uuid_like(bay_ident): return bay.Bay.get_by_name(context, bay_ident) else: return bay.Bay.get_by_uuid(context, bay_ident)
deleted_lines: def retrieve_bay(context, bay_uuid): return bay.Bay.get_by_uuid(context, bay_uuid)

commit_message:
Remove /v1.1 endpoint from api-guide

Since Id695f60e30b14f939973e3610c7750b83a14d0d0 , the endpoint /v1.1
has been removed. So it is nice to remove it from api-guide also to
avoid unnecessary confusions.

Change-Id: I1a70fec5568468c088f60986b9edd8bd1bf97314
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/294832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: * /v1.1 - an alias for v2.0 for backwards compatibilityplease note that the v2.0 and v1.1 API are (almost) identical to first microversion of the v2.1 API and are also covered by this guide.

commit_message:
Add test for domains list filtering and limiting

We test the filtering and limiting of projects, users and groups
lists in test_backends.py, and we don't do this for domains.
Created a special test for the filtering and limiting of domains
list for SQL and LDAP multi-domain classes.

Change-Id: I86094021e2e12e0c0ecf5e1745e0c66ecfb2f96e
Closes-Bug: #1413276
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/56/207456/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystone.common import driver_hintsfrom keystone.tests.unit import filtering tests.TestCase, BaseMultiLDAPandSQLIdentity, filtering.FilterTests): def test_list_domains_filtered_and_limited(self): self.domain_count = 20 self.setup_initial_domains() unfiltered_domains = self._list_entities('domain')() # Should get back just 10 entities self.config_fixture.config(list_limit=10) hints = driver_hints.Hints() hints.add_filter('name', 'domain', comparator='startswith') entities = self._list_entities('domain')(hints=hints) self.assertEqual(hints.limit['limit'], len(entities)) self.assertTrue(hints.limit['truncated']) self._match_with_list(entities, unfiltered_domains) # Finally, let's pretend we want to get the full list of entities, # even with the limits set, as part of some internal calculation. # Calling the API without a hints list should achieve this, and # return at least the 20 entries we created (there may be other # entities lying around created by other tests/setup). entities = self._list_entities('domain')() self.assertTrue(len(entities) >= 20)
deleted_lines: tests.TestCase, BaseMultiLDAPandSQLIdentity):

commit_message:
Change node' ip obtaining when https is forced

We need to add a workaround for an obtaining
ip address for node if the master node uses
https by default. Otherwise we couldn't fetch
it via fuel client because it doesn't
support https proto.

Closes bug: 1558527

Change-Id: I70ee6fe0fc3deea3dcaad8b60cdb409de6f1be61

Fix typo passend should be passenv

Looks like a typo. It should be passenv as mentioned in
tox docs:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html

commit_message:
Enable heat-manage purge_deleted cron job

Without this the heat database tables will grow without limit.

Change-Id: I687e733db1a73ebc2047609a03be768093010dd4
Depends-On: Ia2b80e5003450cd794ebb0c9ca72200ec8616e81
(cherry picked from commit 04cc409c01270fde4703a921a429113e86353864)

commit_message:
Add ensure_thread_contain_context() to task_manager

For async/periodic tasks, the context of local thread is missing.
Set it with request context and this is useful to log the request_id
in log messages.

Change-Id: I436bc0512fcf493424f14e12a17c69f686455a4c
Partial-Bug:#1505119
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/20/284520/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_context import context as oslo_context # NOTE(lintan): This is a workaround to set the context of async tasks, # which should contain an exclusive lock. ensure_thread_contain_context(task.context) ensure_thread_contain_context(context)def ensure_thread_contain_context(context): """Ensure threading contains context For async/periodic tasks, the context of local thread is missing. Set it with request context and this is useful to log the request_id in log messages. :param context: Request context """ if oslo_context.get_current(): return context.update_store()

commit_message:
Add DevStack plugin settings

This patch adds DevStack plugin settings and revises README.
Also, changes using setup.cfg for setup script of DevStack.

Change-Id: Ib390d7a5ac359fc1c4d7f5132204f21747c3e42d

subject: Add ZFSonLinux share driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-07 17:10:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/ce8f4f44f2196d4800efe83ee75c185af569fa13', 'message': "Add ZFSonLinux share driver

Add support for ZFS (on Linux) filesystem.

Following features are supported:
- Create/delete share
- Create/delete snapshot
- Create share from snapshot
- Extend/shrink share
- Update NFS IP-based access rules using new interface.
(SMB support planned for future).
- create/delete/update share replica
(promote to 'active' not supported).

ZFS-related notes:
- Any amount of ZFS zpools can be used by share driver.
- Allowed to configure default options for ZFS datasets that are used
for share creation.
- Any amount of nested datasets is allowed to be used.
- All share replicas are read-only.
- All share replicas are synched periodically, not continuously.
So, status 'in-sync' means latest sync was successful.
Time range between syncs equals to value of
config global opt 'replica_state_update_interval'.

Driver-related notes:
- Able to use remote ZFSonLinux storage as well as local.

TODO:
- Add devstack support
- Update dev docs
- Add unit tests coverage

Implements bp zfsonlinux-driver
Change-Id: I3ddd3767184e4843037de0ac75ff18dce709b6dc
Depends-On: I10515d55b1291c34777a31d8c6a3a1954f551235

"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2016-02-10 19:43:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/d1a8df2578392ff9b27e36b755d897c1bf5b83bf', 'message': "Add ZFSonLinux share driver

Add support for ZFS (on Linux) filesystem.

Following features are supported:
- Create/delete share
- Create/delete snapshot
- Create share from snapshot
- Extend/shrink share
- Update NFS IP-based access rules using new interface.
(SMB support planned for future).
- create/delete/update share replica
(promote to 'active' not supported).

ZFS-related notes:
- Any amount of ZFS zpools can be used by share driver.
- Allowed to configure default options for ZFS datasets that are used
for share creation.
- Any amount of nested datasets is allowed to be used.
- All share replicas are read-only.
- All share replicas are synched periodically, not continuously.
So, status 'in-sync' means latest sync was successful.
Time range between syncs equals to value of
config global opt 'replica_state_update_interval'.

Driver-related notes:
- Able to use remote ZFSonLinux storage as well as local.

TODO:
- Update dev docs
- Add unit tests coverage

Implements bp zfsonlinux-driver
Change-Id: I3ddd3767184e4843037de0ac75ff18dce709b6dc

"}, {'number': 29, 'created': '2016-02-19 11:27:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/798bb96299041d5122f6342ebe7523c2e861f7d8', 'message': "Add ZFSonLinux share driver

Add support for ZFS (on Linux) filesystem.

Following features are supported:
- Create/delete share
- Create/delete snapshot
- Create share from snapshot
- Extend/shrink share
- Update NFS IP-based access rules using new interface.
(SMB support planned for future).
- create/delete/update share replica
(promote to 'active' not supported).

ZFS-related notes:
- Any amount of ZFS zpools can be used by share driver.
- Allowed to configure default options for ZFS datasets that are used
for share creation.
- Any amount of nested datasets is allowed to be used.
- All share replicas are read-only.
- All share replicas are synched periodically, not continuously.
So, status 'in_sync' means latest sync was successful.
Time range between syncs equals to value of
config global opt 'replica_state_update_interval'.

Driver-related notes:
- Able to use remote ZFSonLinux storage as well as local.

TODO:
- Add unit tests coverage

Implements bp zfsonlinux-driver
DocImpact
Change-Id: I3ddd3767184e4843037de0ac75ff18dce709b6dc

commit_message:
Add ZFSonLinux share driver

Add support for ZFS (on Linux) filesystem.

Following features are supported:
- Create/delete share
- Create/delete snapshot
- Create share from snapshot
- Extend/shrink share
- Update NFS IP-based access rules using new interface.
(SMB support planned for future).
- create/delete/update/promote share replica

ZFS-related notes:
- Any amount of ZFS zpools can be used by share driver.
- Allowed to configure default options for ZFS datasets that are used
for share creation.
- Any amount of nested datasets is allowed to be used.
- All share replicas are read-only.
- All share replicas are synched periodically, not continuously.
So, status 'in_sync' means latest sync was successful.
Time range between syncs equals to value of
config global opt 'replica_state_update_interval'.

Driver-related notes:
- Able to use remote ZFSonLinux storage as well as local.

Other made changes:
- updated driver private data DB methods removing filtering by host
  as redundant operation. Replication requires some common metadata
  storage and filtering by host breaks it. It is safe to do so, because
  if driver gets some ID of entity then it is allowed to read its info
  too.

Implements bp zfsonlinux-driver
DocImpact
Change-Id: I3ddd3767184e4843037de0ac75ff18dce709b6dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/92/277192/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def translate_string_size_to_float(string, multiplier='G'): """Translates human-readable storage size to float value. Supported values for 'multiplier' are following: K - kilo | 1 M - mega | 1024 G - giga | 1024 * 1024 T - tera | 1024 * 1024 * 1024 P = peta | 1024 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024 returns: - float if correct input data provided -None if incorrect """ multipliers = ('K', 'M', 'G', 'T', 'P') mapping = { k: 1024.0 ** v for k, v in zip(multipliers, range(len(multipliers))) } if multiplier not in multipliers: raise exception.ManilaException( "'multiplier' arg should be one of following: " "'%(multipliers)s'. But it is '%(multiplier)s'." % { 'multiplier': multiplier, 'multipliers': "', '".join(multipliers), } ) matched = re.match(r"^(\d+)([%s])$" % ','.join(multipliers), string) if matched: value = float(matched.groups()[0]) multiplier = mapping[matched.groups()[1]] / mapping[multiplier] return value * multiplier return matched

subject: Use upper-constraints file in developer mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-21 09:20:01.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/horizon_install.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon/commit/e672a26592bc2c7c6e618b21829b6506852a468e', 'message': 'Use upper-constraints file in developer mode

This commit adds the following new variables:

horizon_requirements_git_repo
horizon_requirements_git_install_branch

When in developer mode, This repo is then cloned in horizon_install.yml
and used as an upper constraint in the functional test to avoid us
installing and running into issues resulting from uncapped dependencies
being installed.

This commit also changes the pip_install_options fact name in
horizon_install.yml to pip_install_options_fact.  This allows us to
maintain the existing pip_install_options variable without overwriting
it with options when in developer mode, which ultimately means we can
have multiple services running in a container use a combination of
*_developer_mode: true and *_developer_mode: false.  At the moment,
if a service writes pip_install_options fact with the constraints
options, those options will persist to other services running in the
container even if *_developer_mode: false.

Change-Id: If481de123073e46825cd5816062f08332d2d98fb
'}]
commit_message:
Use upper-constraints file in developer mode

This commit adds the following new variables:

horizon_requirements_git_repo
horizon_requirements_git_install_branch

When in developer mode, This repo is then cloned in horizon_install.yml
and used as an upper constraint in the functional test to avoid us
installing and running into issues resulting from uncapped dependencies
being installed.

This commit also changes the pip_install_options fact name in
horizon_install.yml to pip_install_options_fact.  This allows us to
maintain the existing pip_install_options variable without overwriting
it with options when in developer mode, which ultimately means we can
have multiple services running in a container use a combination of
*_developer_mode: true and *_developer_mode: false.  At the moment,
if a service writes pip_install_options fact with the constraints
options, those options will persist to other services running in the
container even if *_developer_mode: false.

Change-Id: If481de123073e46825cd5816062f08332d2d98fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon refs/changes/53/295153/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: horizon_requirements_git_repo: https://git.openstack.org/openstack/requirements horizon_requirements_git_install_branch: master

commit_message:
Standardise installation-related task files

Most IRR roles have identical pre_install and install YAML task files.
This makes it easy to change them across the board.  Horizon, however,
has a number of tasks in the pre_install YAML file where on the other
roles these tasks lie in the install YAML.

This commit moves the following from horizon_pre_install to
horizon_install.yml:

Install requires pip packages
Get local venv checksum
Get remote venv checksum
Attempt venv download
Set horizon get_venv fact
Remove existing venv
Create horizon venv dir
Unarchive pre-built venv
Update virtualenv path
Create horizon venv
Create horizon links for venv
Create static horizon dir

Additionally, we delete the 'Create horizon venv' task as there should
be no reason to install horizon_requires_pip_packages into the venv
itself.  This also requires moving 'Create horizon links for venv' and
'Create static horizon dir' to the end of horizon_install.yml since the
venv does not exist at this point as the 'Install pip packages (venv)'
still needs to run.

With this change in place, it becomes easier to make changes across all
roles as they should now all follow a similar pattern.

Change-Id: Ie22b2ccdfb5e1f58b09c6740d16c9b538521143c

commit_message:
Remove broken package "pywbem"

This pacakge is causing system breakage due to a new version being
released that is otherwise incompatible with requirements as found
within OpenStack. After reviewing the package usage and the reason
it's been included but the only thing I could find that actually
uses this resource was cinder and only when using the EMC VMAX
driver: http://paste.openstack.org/show/491185/ -- being that this
package is not even listed in global requirements and is not in
support of anything we could say is a common backend within Cinder
that we know we're currently supporting I am of the opinion that
this package should be removed.

Depends-On: I152fa0130e64ad5756b413ed8f9714d28e75d0bb
Depends-On: I6c7ad22df1c788ff05bec00cfea8f3d8fa47b679
Change-Id: I7b8cf72032433deaa5db0647eacc075dd597c566
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Change header of homepage status panel to camel case

This commit changes the header of the homepage status panel to camel
case. Originally, only first words was lowercases such as 'project
Status', 'filename Status', etc. It's a little wired. So This commit
fixes it. And this commit changes snake cases to camel cases, too. For
example, 'build_branch Status' -> 'Build Branch Status'.

Change-Id: I2a3cb01640c83d5211bad7831be8a3ff67049629

commit_message:
Fix dict.keys() incompatibility in py34 in dhcp test

os.listdir() returns a list. But in py34, dict.keys()
will no longer return a list, but a iterable. So we
should not assume dict.keys() returns a list in tests.

This problem has not been tested out because we used
assertEqual() to test the result. sorted() will return
a list even if an iterable is passed in. We'd better
not use functions like sorted() to change the type
of the object to be tested.

So in this patch, we use assertItemsEqual() instead to
test if two lists equal to each other, which is not
order sensitive.

Change-Id: I365bcbb35a05c2587953383709254bd2064a69f7
Partial-Bug: #1556379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/48/292048/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: mock_listdir.return_value = cases.keys() self.assertEqual(['aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaaa', 'bbbbbbbb-bbbb-bbbb-bbbb-bbbbbbbbbbbb'], sorted(result))

commit_message:
Fix wrong use of list of dict in _check_driver_to_bind

From [1], the segments_to_bind should be a list of dict, so the
"level.segment_id in segments_to_bind" will never work.

This patch extracts a set of segment ids and uses the set in the
if condition.

[1] https://goo.gl/yKYSTA

Change-Id: I58f1d128e6cd79546d84f7d5bfcb026affc4fc5e
Closes-bug: #1524356
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/59/271959/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: level.segment_id in segments_to_bind):

commit_message:
Add support for partition images in agent drivers

This patch enables the partition image support for
agent drivers which support `boot` iterface.

Partial-Bug: 1526289

Co-Authored-By: Nisha Agarwal <agarwalnisha1980@gmail.com>

Depends-on: I22bc29a39bf5c35f3eecb6d4e51cebd6aee0ce1

commit_message:
Fix assertNotEqual parameters

One parameter shuffle for assertNotEqual was missed being
converted to ( expected, obeserved ). This patch fixes the
parameter order.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I1a24d97b2b0fdc1c456520c917484333cf92618f

deleted_lines: self.assertNotEqual(cm.excess, 0)

commit_message:
Gate: Allow jenkins user access to logs

The logs collected by the gate check are not all readable by the
jenkins user in OpenStack-CI. This patch ensures that it does.

Backport note:
The 'pywbem' cap is added to allow a gate pass. This will be
removed in a follow-on patch.

Change-Id: Ie8197c1aaccbbb052b7f58bb396fe1e1afb1b7cf
(cherry picked from commit a831ca82d1e2985a13478964781e1e42e21670e9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/69/295369/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check if the logs link is in place. This will only be true when the # environment was built by the gate-check-commit script. if [ -h $(dirname ${0})/../logs ]; then # Ensure that all directories may be traversed by all users, and that # all files are readable by all users. chmod --recursive o+rX $(dirname ${0})/../logs fi

commit_message:
use wipefs to erase FS meta information

destroy_disk_metadata should destroy a bit more data than expected if we
want to be sure grub won't conflict with remaining bits of filesystem.
grub probes the hard drive to find remaining partition or filesystem. If
it find something, it will refuse to install itself on the disk.

By using wipefs instead of dd, we not only erase the MBR and partition
table but also all trace of filesystem, raid or partition-table signatures
(magic strings). This without extra Python code.

wipefs is part of util-linux which is available on all the Linux
distribution.

References:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284347/
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1310883
Partial-Bug: 1550604

Change-Id: I39637e22c344703ad48fc271f6f866aa018bbdd1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-lib refs/changes/83/286283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: utils.execute('wipefs', '--all', dev, run_as_root=True, check_exit_code=[0], use_standard_locale=True)
deleted_lines: try: utils.dd('/dev/zero', dev, 'bs=512', 'count=36') except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as err: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to erase beginning of disk for node " "%(node)s. Command: %(command)s. Error: %(error)s."), {'node': node_uuid, 'command': err.cmd, 'error': err.stderr}) # now wipe the end of the disk. # get end of disk seek value try: block_sz = get_dev_block_size(dev) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as err: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to get disk block count for node %(node)s. " "Command: %(command)s. Error: %(error)s."), {'node': node_uuid, 'command': err.cmd, 'error': err.stderr}) else: seek_value = block_sz - 36 try: utils.dd('/dev/zero', dev, 'bs=512', 'count=36', 'seek=%d' % seek_value) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as err: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to erase the end of the disk on node " "%(node)s. Command: %(command)s. " "Error: %(error)s."), {'node': node_uuid, 'command': err.cmd, 'error': err.stderr})

commit_message:
Allow multiple plugins to handle an event

Modifies the listener registration to allow 1 or more plugins to handle
any given event.

WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import mock from searchlight.elasticsearch.plugins import base from searchlight import listener import searchlight.tests.utils as test_utils class PretendNotificationHandler(base.NotificationBase): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): index_helper = mock.Mock() options = mock.Mock() super(PretendNotificationHandler, self).__init__(index_helper, options, *args, **kwargs) self.event1_called_with = [] @classmethod def _get_notification_exchanges(cls): return [] def get_event_handlers(self): return { 'test.create.end': self.event1 } def event1(self, payload, timestamp): self.event1_called_with.append((payload, timestamp)) class StevedorePlugin(object): def __init__(self, name, plugin): self._plugin = plugin self._name = name @property def name(self): return self._name @property def obj(self): return self._plugin class TestListener(test_utils.BaseTestCase): def test_multiple_event_handlers(self): listener1 = PretendNotificationHandler() plugin1 = mock.Mock() plugin1.get_notification_handler.return_value = listener1 listener2 = PretendNotificationHandler() plugin2 = mock.Mock() plugin2.get_notification_handler.return_value = listener2 plugins = {'plugin1': StevedorePlugin('plugin1', plugin1), 'plugin2': StevedorePlugin('plugin1', plugin2)} notification_ep = listener.NotificationEndpoint(plugins) self.assertEqual(['test.create.end'], list(notification_ep.notification_target_map.keys())) self.assertEqual( set([plugin1, plugin2]), set(notification_ep.notification_target_map['test.create.end'])) notification_ep.info({}, None, 'test.create.end', {'test': 'payload'}, {'timestamp': 1234}) self.assertEqual([({'test': 'payload'}, 1234)], listener1.event1_called_with) self.assertEqual([({'test': 'payload'}, 1234)], listener2.event1_called_with)

repositories for Mitaka.  Mitaka final comes out 1 week after
the release of OpenStack (~April 15th).

commit_message:
Fixes the agent message for uefi netboot for partition image

The agent returns "efi_system_partition_uuid=None" in the
status message for uefi netboot for partition images.
This commit fixes to remove this unwanted message
from the status message as efi partition is created only
for localboot.

Closes-bug: 1526289

Change-Id: I6376406cdde29493619f50b0a6cd8b6ce3784d6e

commit_message:
Consistent resource.prop for timestamps and booleans (orchestration)

This patch set updates all orchestration objects to use consistent
resource.prop for timestamps and booleans. In particular, the
following changes were made:
  - Clarify documentation for timestamp and boolean attributes
  - Use 'is_' prefix and boolean type for boolean attributes
  - Use '_at' suffix and timestamp type for timestamp attributes

Change-Id: Ic84a481a25e845ad3e05ffeefb55d56371b571bc
Partial-Bug: #1544584

commit_message:
Add ability to create security groups from puppet

Change-Id: I1835f121726e2b99bd6cc62e67849a0bc248ea4f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/89/293989/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # # Copyright (C) 2016 Mirantis Inc. # # Author: Alexey Deryugin <aderyugin@mirantis.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # nova_security_group type # # == Parameters # [*ip_protocol*] # IP protocol from new security rule # Required # # [*from_port*] # Port range begin for security rule # Required # # [*to_port*] # Port range end for security rule # Required # # [*ip_range*] # IP range for security rule # Optional # # [*source_group*] # Source group for security rule # Optional # # [*security_group*] # Target security group for security rule # Required # require 'puppet' Puppet::Type.newtype(:nova_secrule) do desc "Manage nova security rules" ensurable newparam(:name) do isnamevar end newparam(:ip_protocol) do defaultto do raise Puppet::Error, 'You should give protocol!' end newvalues 'tcp', 'udp', 'icmp' end newparam(:from_port) do defaultto do raise Puppet::Error, 'You should give the source port!' end validate do |value| if value !~ /\d+/ or value.to_i <= 0 or value.to_i >= 65536 raise Puppet::Error, 'Incorrect from port!' end end end newparam(:to_port) do defaultto do raise Puppet::Error, 'You should give the destination port!' end validate do |value| if value !~ /\d+/ or value.to_i <= 0 or value.to_i >= 65536 raise Puppet::Error, 'Incorrect to port!' end end end newparam(:ip_range) do validate do |value| def is_cidr_net?(value) begin address, mask = value.split('/') return false unless address and mask octets = address.split('.') return false unless octets.length == 4 cidr = true octets.each do |octet| n = octet.to_i cidr = false unless n <= 255 cidr = false unless n >= 0 break unless cidr end cidr = false unless mask.to_i <= 32 cidr = false unless mask.to_i >= 0 cidr rescue false end end raise Puppet::Error, 'Incorrect ip_range!' unless is_cidr_net? value end end newparam(:source_group) do end newparam(:security_group) do defaultto do raise Puppet::Error, 'You should provide the secutity group to add this rule to!' end end validate do unless !!self[:ip_range] ^ !!self[:source_group] raise Puppet::Error, 'You should give either ip_range or source_group. Not none or both!' end unless self[:from_port].to_i <= self[:to_port].to_i raise Puppet::Error, 'From_port should be lesser or equal to to_port!' end end end

revisions:

commit_message:
Use get_by_args instead of get_by_host_and_topic

We already changed to use get_by_args, but in init_host_with_rpc,
it still called get_by_host_and_topic instead of get_by_args.
Which would cause restart a disabled cinder-volume service failed

Change-Id: I10f562b4298e548f681030a71c828e3d2265e416
Closes-Bug: 1557366
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/80/292780/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: service = objects.Service.get_by_args( context.get_admin_context(), svc_host, 'cinder-volume')
deleted_lines: service = objects.Service.get_by_host_and_topic( context.get_admin_context(), svc_host, CONF.volume_topic)

commit_message:
Add a configurable setting in barbican-functional.conf for timeouts

When debugging API calls, you often timeout because of breakpoints.
The default value is 10 seconds which isn't long enough for debugging.
This CR makes that setting configurable in barbican-functional.conf
and retains the default of 10 seconds.

Change-Id: I51685d5df903088773cba4ca624bbd0360ed0d16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/64/295464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.IntOpt('timeout', default=10),

commit_message:
Add PKCS#11 upgrade release note

Change-Id: Ic0b70f331ebe2dddada247615d8c64b32300c4b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/22/294222/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > The Mitaka release includes signifcant improvements to the performance of the PCKS#11 Cryptographic Backend driver. These changes will require a data migration of any existing data stored by previous versions of the PKCS#11 backend. issues: - The service will encounter errors if you attempt to run this new release using data that has not yet been migrated. The logged errors will look like P11CryptoPluginException: HSM returned response code: 0xc0L CKR_SIGNATURE_INVALID upgrade: - If you are upgrading from previous version of barbican that uses the PCKS#11 Cryptographic Backend driver, you will need to run the migration script. python barbican/cmd/pkcs11_migrate_kek_signatures.py critical: - If you are upgrading from previous version of barbican that uses the PCKS#11 Cryptographic Backend driver, you will need to run the migration script. python barbican/cmd/pkcs11_migrate_kek_signatures.py

commit_message:
Ceilometer Config Reference update

Change-Id: Ib91f8aaa42f875fe8ce1aedcbeae01c846dfbb69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/26/294826/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * - ``channel_max`` = ``None`` - (IntOpt) Maximum number of channels to allow * - ``default_notification_exchange`` = ``${control_exchange}_notification`` - (StrOpt) Exchange name for for sending notifications * - ``default_notification_retry_attempts`` = ``-1`` - (IntOpt) Reconnecting retry count in case of connectivity problem during sending notification, -1 means infinite retry. * - ``default_rpc_exchange`` = ``${control_exchange}_rpc`` - (StrOpt) Exchange name for sending RPC messages * - ``default_rpc_retry_attempts`` = ``-1`` - (IntOpt) Reconnecting retry count in case of connectivity problem during sending RPC message, -1 means infinite retry. If actual retry attempts in not 0 the rpc request could be processed more then one time * - ``frame_max`` = ``None`` - (IntOpt) The maximum byte size for an AMQP frame * - ``heartbeat_interval`` = ``1`` - (IntOpt) How often to send heartbeats for consumer's connections * - ``host_connection_reconnect_delay`` = ``0.25`` - (FloatOpt) Set delay for reconnection to some host which has connection error * - ``notification_listener_prefetch_count`` = ``100`` - (IntOpt) Max number of not acknowledged message which RabbitMQ can send to notification listener. * - ``notification_persistence`` = ``False`` - (BoolOpt) Persist notification messages. * - ``notification_retry_delay`` = ``0.25`` - (FloatOpt) Reconnecting retry delay in case of connectivity problem during sending notification message * - ``pool_max_overflow`` = ``0`` - (IntOpt) Maximum number of connections to create above `pool_max_size`. * - ``pool_max_size`` = ``10`` - (IntOpt) Maximum number of connections to keep queued. * - ``pool_recycle`` = ``600`` - (IntOpt) Lifetime of a connection (since creation) in seconds or None for no recycling. Expired connections are closed on acquire. * - ``pool_stale`` = ``60`` - (IntOpt) Threshold at which inactive (since release) connections are considered stale in seconds or None for no staleness. Stale connections are closed on acquire. * - ``pool_timeout`` = ``30`` - (IntOpt) Default number of seconds to wait for a connections to available - (BoolOpt) Try to use HA queues in RabbitMQ (x-ha-policy: all). If you change this option, you must wipe the RabbitMQ database. In RabbitMQ 3.0, queue mirroring is no longer controlled by the x-ha-policy argument when declaring a queue. If you just want to make sure that all queues (except those with auto-generated names) are mirrored across all nodes, run: "rabbitmqctl set_policy HA '^(?!amq\.).*' '{"ha-mode": "all"}' " * - ``rabbit_transient_queues_ttl`` = ``1800`` * - ``rpc_listener_prefetch_count`` = ``100`` - (IntOpt) Max number of not acknowledged message which RabbitMQ can send to rpc listener. * - ``rpc_queue_expiration`` = ``60`` - (IntOpt) Time to live for rpc queues without consumers in seconds. * - ``rpc_reply_exchange`` = ``${control_exchange}_rpc_reply`` - (StrOpt) Exchange name for receiving RPC replies * - ``rpc_reply_listener_prefetch_count`` = ``100`` - (IntOpt) Max number of not acknowledged message which RabbitMQ can send to rpc reply listener. * - ``rpc_reply_retry_attempts`` = ``-1`` - (IntOpt) Reconnecting retry count in case of connectivity problem during sending reply. -1 means infinite retry during rpc_timeout * - ``rpc_reply_retry_delay`` = ``0.25`` - (FloatOpt) Reconnecting retry delay in case of connectivity problem during sending reply. * - ``rpc_retry_delay`` = ``0.25`` - (FloatOpt) Reconnecting retry delay in case of connectivity problem during sending RPC message * - ``socket_timeout`` = ``0.25`` - (FloatOpt) Set socket timeout in seconds for connection's socket * - ``ssl`` = ``None`` - (BoolOpt) Enable SSL * - ``ssl_options`` = ``None`` - (DictOpt) Arguments passed to ssl.wrap_socket * - ``tcp_user_timeout`` = ``0.25`` - (FloatOpt) Set TCP_USER_TIMEOUT in seconds for connection's socket

If actual retry attempts in not 0 the rpc request could be processed more then one time * - ``frame_max`` = ``None`` - (IntOpt) The maximum byte size for an AMQP frame * - ``heartbeat_interval`` = ``1`` - (IntOpt) How often to send heartbeats for consumer's connections * - ``host_connection_reconnect_delay`` = ``0.25`` - (FloatOpt) Set delay for reconnection to some host which has connection error * - ``notification_listener_prefetch_count`` = ``100`` - (IntOpt) Max number of not acknowledged message which RabbitMQ can send to notification listener. * - ``notification_persistence`` = ``False`` - (BoolOpt) Persist notification messages. * - ``notification_retry_delay`` = ``0.25`` - (FloatOpt) Reconnecting retry delay in case of connectivity problem during sending notification message * - ``pool_max_overflow`` = ``0`` - (IntOpt) Maximum number of connections to create above `pool_max_size`. * - ``pool_max_size`` = ``10`` - (IntOpt) Maximum number of connections to keep queued. * - ``pool_recycle`` = ``600`` - (IntOpt) Lifetime of a connection (since creation) in seconds or None for no recycling. commit_message:
add paramiko to requirements.txt

adding paramiko to requirements.txt, while not a direct dependency of
Bifrost it is a dependency of ansible. Adding to requirements ensures
that it is installed.

Change-Id: I4cd18c43fa2a30f6003c374d3989c6d378ad39ef
Closes-bug: 1559586

commit_message:
Don't depend on existing file perm for qemu hook

For defensive purposes, lets make sure the hooks/qemu file is set to be
executable. Rather than relying on the source file permissions.

Change-Id: I2130adea4855f6e989dd8fb995cb830db76ba2a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/39/294139/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo chmod -v +x $IRONIC_LIBVIRT_HOOKS_PATH/qemu

commit_message:
Fix argument name bug

Since ok-actions, undetermined-actions, alarm-actions and match-by
are positional args for the method alarm-definition-update, they don't get
the dash in the name auto mapped to the underscore. So, trying to access them
as with the underscores fails. So, change the names of the args to have
the underscore so the names can be accessed correctly

Change-Id: I4201bdb26b1f41945a4bf132f6e5061c3e6b01d4
Closes-Bug: #1555811

commit_message:
Handle swift store's optional dependency

python_swiftclient is an optional dependencies for
glance_store. It's considered better to raise a BadStoreConfig
to the user instead of failing with an import error.

Change-Id: Iebc97cffb1d4af5fabb9374d577045ff79a98d49
(cherry picked from commit c2b8702a82faf0d117746cdc44290929480f4368)
Closes-Bug: #1535602
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/47/226947/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: import swiftclient except ImportError: swiftclient = None if swiftclient is None: msg = _("Missing dependency python_swiftclient.") raise exceptions.BadStoreConfiguration(store_name="swift", reason=msg)
deleted_lines: import swiftclient

commit_message:
Remove location check from V2 client

Glance client has a custom check that generates exception if
location has not been returned by image-get request.
This check should on server side and it should be managed by
policy rules when do location-add action.
That also allows to increase possibility of migrating Heat
to v2[1].

NOTE: After this patch, we'll raise a HTTPBadRequest from
server side instead of HTTPConflict when a user adds a
duplicate location.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240450/

commit_message:
vCenter detection reads hypervisor.conf

    - modify vcenter detection plugin to read the details
      from hypervisor.conf instead of nova.conf
    - oslo.vmware dependency added to requirements.txt

Change-Id: I6f7aa966ccdad711269a643eebffa7396359aa72

commit_message:
Improve error for token issue command without auth

Currently when you perform the 'token issue' command with
the admin_token, the error is a nonsense python error. This
commit changes it to be user-friendly.

Change-Id: I5cc92c342e3f83e099354cd04301c7b8d8d2dabc
Closes-Bug: #1547721

commit_message:
Image API v2: make volume_type optional

It is perfectly valid for a Cinder volume to have a volume_type of
"none", so don't make the Image API v2 require that one be set.

Change-Id: I1a6da8d791fa0ae67cac46eec81bcbcb420729c3
Closes-Bug: #1559344

commit_message:
is_public=N/A in output of cinder type-update

In output of cinder type-update execution, is_public field
always displays N/A.
This is due to wrong usage of @property for is_public field
in code.

Change-Id: I1d76c3d5c937f5c16c668bd114e2df7dfc62f2f8
Closes-Bug: #1538412
(cherry picked from commit 7d1e4d9baf76a2e42424acdaeb37265f8bdcfff1)

commit_message:
Fix the format problem of LOG in failover_host

In the failover_host function in manager.py. it misses
the 's' after %(backend_id), so if the driver throws exception,
it will throw another one too.

Change-Id: Ie676f3e0fb76a85c752d0e8dbe74bd9b214e4d0d
Closes-Bug: 1559399

deleted_lines: "%(host)s invalid target ID %(backend_id)"),

commit_message:
Adds HA router functional test

Validates that an instance pair is booted for an HA router and
that the cluster is rebuilt if one server is deleted via Nova.

Depends-On: Icbca3966901d22978bd987faa00b0f48d5e453bb
Change-Id: I9bd4c35343004b01e6539c935f47eca56e6fd2eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/astara refs/changes/02/286902/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class AstaraRouterTestBase(base.AstaraFunctionalBase): HA_ROUTER = False super(AstaraRouterTestBase, cls).setUpClass() cls.network, cls.router = cls.tenant.setup_networking( ha_router=cls.HA_ROUTER) super(AstaraRouterTestBase, self).setUp() self.assert_router_is_active(self.router['id'], self.HA_ROUTER) HA_ROUTER = False @property def router_ha(self): router = self.admin_clients.neutronclient.show_router( self.router['id'])['router'] return router.get('ha', False) class TestAstaraHARouter(AstaraRouterTestBase): HA_ROUTER = True def test_ha_router_servers(self): service_instances = self.get_router_appliance_server( self.router['id'], ha_router=self.HA_ROUTER) self.assertEqual(len(service_instances), 2) # kill the master and ensure it is backfilled with a new instance master, backup = service_instances self.admin_clients.novaclient.servers.delete(master.id) LOG.debug('Waiting %s seconds for astara health check to tick', CONF.health_check_period) time.sleep(CONF.health_check_period) service_instances = self.get_router_appliance_server( self.router['id'], ha_router=self.HA_ROUTER) self.assertEqual(len(service_instances), 2) self.assertEqual(service_instances[0], backup) class TestAstaraRouter(AstaraRouterTestBase): HA_ROUTER = False
deleted_lines: class TestAstaraRouter(base.AstaraFunctionalBase): super(TestAstaraRouter, cls).setUpClass() cls.network, cls.router = cls.tenant.setup_networking() super(TestAstaraRouter, self).setUp() self.assert_router_is_active(self.router['id'])

Refactor osnailyfacter/modular/ceph to be compatible with Puppet Master

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/73/287673/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: include ::osnailyfacter::ceph::ceph_pools
deleted_lines: notice('MODULAR: ceph/ceph_pools') $storage_hash = hiera('storage', {}) $osd_pool_default_pg_num = $storage_hash['pg_num'] $osd_pool_default_pgp_num = $storage_hash['pg_num'] # Cinder settings $cinder_user = 'volumes' $cinder_pool = 'volumes' # Cinder Backup settings $cinder_backup_user = 'backups' $cinder_backup_pool = 'backups' # Glance settings $glance_user = 'images' $glance_pool = 'images' Exec { path => [ '/bin/', '/sbin/' , '/usr/bin/', '/usr/sbin/' ], cwd => '/root', } $per_pool_pg_nums = $storage_hash['per_pool_pg_nums'] # DO NOT SPLIT ceph auth command lines! See http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/3279 ceph::pool {$glance_pool: user => $glance_user, acl => "mon 'allow r' osd 'allow class-read object_prefix rbd_children, allow rwx pool=${glance_pool}'", keyring_owner => 'glance', pg_num => pick($per_pool_pg_nums[$glance_pool], '256'), pgp_num => pick($per_pool_pg_nums[$glance_pool], '256'), } ceph::pool {$cinder_pool: user => $cinder_user, acl => "mon 'allow r' osd 'allow class-read object_prefix rbd_children, allow rwx pool=${cinder_pool}, allow rx pool=${glance_pool}'", keyring_owner => 'cinder', pg_num => pick($per_pool_pg_nums[$cinder_pool], '2048'), pgp_num => pick($per_pool_pg_nums[$cinder_pool], '2048'), } ceph::pool {$cinder_backup_pool: user => $cinder_backup_user, acl => "mon 'allow r' osd 'allow class-read object_prefix rbd_children, allow rwx pool=${cinder_backup_pool}, allow rwx pool=${cinder_pool}'", keyring_owner => 'cinder', pg_num => pick($per_pool_pg_nums[$cinder_backup_pool], '512'), pgp_num => pick($per_pool_pg_nums[$cinder_backup_pool], '512'), } Ceph::Pool[$glance_pool] -> Ceph::Pool[$cinder_pool] -> Ceph::Pool[$cinder_backup_pool] if ($storage_hash['volumes_ceph']) { include ::cinder::params service { 'cinder-volume': ensure => 'running', name => $::cinder::params::volume_service, hasstatus => true, hasrestart => true, } Ceph::Pool[$cinder_pool] ~> Service['cinder-volume'] service { 'cinder-backup': ensure => 'running', name => $::cinder::params::backup_service, hasstatus => true, hasrestart => true, } Ceph::Pool[$cinder_backup_pool] ~> Service['cinder-backup'] } if ($storage_hash['images_ceph']) { include ::glance::params service { 'glance-api': ensure => 'running', name => $::glance::params::api_service_name, hasstatus => true, hasrestart => true, } Ceph::Pool[$glance_pool] ~> Service['glance-api'] }

commit_message:
Add uselist=True to subnet rbac_entries relationship

Because the join conditions for Subnet rbac entries
are manually specified, SQLAlchemy is not
automatically detecting that this relationship is a list.
This adds the uselist=True kwarg to the relationship to
ensure that it's always handled as a list.

Change-Id: Ia4ae57ddd932260691584ae74c0305a79b2e60a9
Closes-Bug: #1557959

commit_message:
Replace copy.deepcopy of RequestContext with copy.copy

Instance of RequestContext contains many objects and some of them like
mutexes could not be copied. Also a deepcopy of the entire
RequestContext wastes CPU time.

To avoid problems with deepcopy and avoid performance overhead this
patch changes deepcopy of RequestContext to shallow copy and makes
deepcopy of only the 'roles' member because of security issue
LP #1386932.

Closes-Bug: #1506958
Related-Bug: #1386932
Change-Id: I1e2c00e95e1c4bcd0ec7bf075458789d6fb06e99
(cherry picked from commit 82457f2462621b6a9c653dce2baf38d0623e25ee)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/288529/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context = copy.copy(self) # context.roles must be deepcopied to leave original roles # without changes context.roles = copy.deepcopy(self.roles)
deleted_lines: context = copy.deepcopy(self)

commit_message:
Switch to oslo.log

The old oslo-incubator log module isn't maintained (and doesn't even
exist anymore), so we don't really want to be using it.  It appears
this was the only incubator module we were actually using, so this
allows us to remove all of the unmaintained incubator code.

Change-Id: Ib4ad3b231360987a1ef4f95b5b5a8b656232efc4

commit_message:
Delete the Linux-IO target before setting up local boot

Otherwise it fails with "device already mounted".

Change-Id: If959ba5a10e97f84be2f7498bed7589d13fa30c2
Closes-Bug: #1526304
Closes-Bug: #1551250
(cherry-picked from commit 4cd64e28aa24e91534800288ab1c60407b4a722f)

commit_message:
Remove broken package "pywbem"

This pacakge is causing system breakage due to a new version being
released that is otherwise incompatible with requirements as found
within OpenStack. After reviewing the package usage and the reason
it's been included but the only thing I could find that actually
uses this resource was cinder and only when using the EMC VMAX
driver: http://paste.openstack.org/show/491185/ -- being that this
package is not even listed in global requirements and is not in
support of anything we could say is a common backend within Cinder
that we know we're currently supporting I am of the opinion that
this package should be removed.

Depends-On: I152fa0130e64ad5756b413ed8f9714d28e75d0bb
Depends-On: I6c7ad22df1c788ff05bec00cfea8f3d8fa47b679
Change-Id: I7b8cf72032433deaa5db0647eacc075dd597c566
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Ensure keystone service is created before openrc

If puppet compiles catalog with openrc being created before
the keystone service and keystone endpoint is created it will
result in an empty service catalog. This change adds a dependency
to ensure they're created before openrc.

Change-Id: I2bac57898ae645ae578ed55d620c89b7c0dcb3d1
Closes-Bug: 1559292

commit_message:
Add generate_passwords.py to generate passwords

As with all tools, this is a first pass at the generation. Perhaps we
even want to move this into kolla/kolla/cmd and be generated with tox
itself in the future.

This tool, when run, will only populate empty fields that have no
values meaning that it is safe to run repeatedly on the same file.

Of note, there is no way to preserve comments in the file after it has
been processed by the yaml parser in python. Comments and sections
will remain in the passwords.yml template for additional documentation
if the user wishes to populate the file themselves.

Use SystemRandom and clean up the docs a bit to not use pronouns.

Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>

Closes-Bug: #1559266
Change-Id: I2932d592df8871f1b7811059206d0b4d0553a687

commit_message:
Gate: Allow jenkins user access to logs

The logs collected by the gate check are not all readable by the
jenkins user in OpenStack-CI. This patch ensures that it does.

Backport note:
The 'pywbem' cap is added to allow a gate pass. This will be
removed in a follow-on patch.

Change-Id: Ie8197c1aaccbbb052b7f58bb396fe1e1afb1b7cf
(cherry picked from commit a831ca82d1e2985a13478964781e1e42e21670e9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/70/295370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check if the logs link is in place. This will only be true when the # environment was built by the gate-check-commit script. if [ -h $(dirname ${0})/../logs ]; then # Ensure that all directories may be traversed by all users, and that # all files are readable by all users. chmod --recursive o+rX $(dirname ${0})/../logs fi

commit_message:
Pass RabbitMQ's password from the client

In the tripleo templates the RabbitMQ password is set as
the default but can be overriden. It's not a good security pratice to
use that default so this change enables the autogeneration of
that parameter.

Conflicts:
    tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py
    tripleoclient/tests/v1/utils.py

Bug: #1557688
Change-Id: I9c2f2b82ab2780ff325f90f5e038f3b7f3b5cf61
(cherry picked from commit 309eef1005885ba8d90a2d3f7afea572ec57fc82)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/70/293870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parameters['RabbitPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_RABBITMQ_PASSWORD']

commit_message:
Release 8.0.0

* Update CHANGELOG file to document the right URL for release notes.
* Update beaker_spec_helper and rake_tasks to checkout stable/mitaka.
* Update version in version.rb, to match with other modules versionning.
* Improve index.rst to list releases and propose indices and tables.
* Add mitaka.rst to track notes added in stable/mitaka.
* Update .gitreview

Change-Id: I9eedb76279e5f2bf61b7819c55433b1393d312aa
(cherry picked from commit 4150a405cac1939b1978c2c023f329ff98681c07)

commit_message:
LXC/LXD: Fix for share race condition

Original implementation of LXC/LXD driver was prone to race
conditions due to incorrect share handling. This patch removes
storing share as attribute to fix the issue.

Change-Id: I67a3b3793732196a6aa67c7fac9d02503a47ca52
Closes-bug: #1556802

commit_message:
Add experimental puppet-openstackci-beaker job for ubuntu-trusty

This is part of the ongoing effort to remove devstack-trusty from the
gate and replace it with ubuntu-trusty.

Change-Id: I611b28d6e12dc2140e13df922b125364f0459e4d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
